A Shooting Star.Line: Kupo! I smell a munny maker, kupo!
Aw phooey! How did this happen?
I don't know, Donald. It's like the whole thing just fell apart. Gawrsh! Is that what I think it is?

A Gummi Ship in Ruins.Line: A Gummi block! How did you do that?
I think maybe it's 'cause of this.  When a Gummi Heartless is defeated, this Gummi radar retrieves the Gummi block it was carrying. Of course, we couldn't have done it without our new friend!
Oh. Okay...Hey! I almost forgot! Why do YOU have a Keyblade? Masked figures in white robes? Chirithy? What's the big idea!? How come I've never heard of them before?
Well, maybe it's because we're someplace new. I bet there's still lots we don't know about this world.

Say, maybe you can help us. We came here in a Gummi ship, but it fell apart when we landed. And then the blocks that the ship was made of were stolen by the Heartless. Do you think you can help us get 'em back?
Goofy! What are you doing!? We don't need help. We can do it on our own.
No, we can't, Donald. Remember, we don't have anything to fight with.
So, what do ya say, pal? Do ya think you could collect the Gummi blocks we need?
Yeah. It sure would help us.
Gawrsh, thanks! Oh, and be sure to take this with ya. We'll be right here tryin' to rebuild the ship with the parts we still have.

Not Quite Right.Line: Thanks! You sure found lots of pieces. Now let's see if we can put 'em together.
WAK! Goofy! That doesn't go there!
Hmm, I don't remember our ship lookin' like this.
Yeah, there's something screwy going on.
Uh, Donald? I don't think that's a spaceship.
WAK! What do you mean it's not a– Hey! That's not a spaceship! This is all your fault.
Uh...It looks like we're still missin' a few blocks. Could ya collect some more for us?

Mickey, Chip, and Dale.Line: Uh-oh! There's darkness in this world too...Oh, and Keyblade wielders. Hiya, pal. I'm Mickey. It looks like I took a surprise journey to a new world. Say, have you seen my friends Donald and Goofy? They would have appeared outta the sky just like me. Their ship was destroyed? And you're helping them rebuild it? Gosh, thanks! Guess it's a lucky thing I landed here. Of course, I never would have made it without my two co-pilots.
Your Majesty, remind me to show you how to use the brakes next time!

Sorry, Chip. Sorry, Dale. It's just that I was in a hurry. Now, I've gotta go look into something. Fellas, would you two go and give Donald and Goofy a hand? Just follow our new friend. Say pal, would you show them the way? Thanks!
So it wasn't the Star Shard that led me here. Hmm...What exactly is going on?

Missing Parts.Line: No, it's not! It's not neat! It's a disaster! How did this happen?
I don't know. Chip, what do you think? Huh? Chip! Dale! You're here!
We're missing a bunch of core parts.
Yep! You'll need lots of those if you want the ship to fly again.
Gawrsh pal, I guess we'll be needin' some more of your help.

Taking Flight.Line: Ta-da! You better check the engine.
The ship's gonna fall apart if we don't take off! Now!
C'mon, it's time to go home– to our world.
They were a friendly, noisy bunch, weren't they? So HE's the King.
It's finally complete! Now I can open up shop in every corner of the world, kupo! Now for a test drive. H-how do you board this thing? Back to the drawing board, kupo...

Corridor of Darkness.Line: You've been doing a fantastic job lately. So, I have a present for you! Dun dada duun! The Bracelet of Light! I'm glad you're excited, but gee, calm down. Why don't you put it somewhere for safekeeping? With that bracelet, you can protect yourself against darkness. You'll need it for the special mission we got from the foretellers. You'll be doing the same thing, you know, dealing with monsters...just in a different, darker place...Your mission is to defeat the HEartless in the Corridor of Darkness. But be careful. That bracelet can only protect you for so long. I knew I could count on you, kiddo. Now go and get 'em! I'm rootin' for you!

Darkness Draws Near.Line: You were great in there, kiddo! Let's call it a day. But  you never know when we'll get another mission like this, so be prepared!
E-excuse me...Don't you think it was a little early for him/her to take on this mission?
I have no choice but to hasten their training. They must strengthen their resistance to the darkness as quickly as possible.
The darkness is drawing near. We need as many warriors as we can get on our side– the side of light.

The Secret.Line: This secret must stay with the five of you. When all is said and done, you must come to the fated land. You'll be joined by four others.
Am I the second to arrive?
Skuld? Well, this is a surprise!
Disappointed? I, on the other hand, had a feeling you might be here.
Of course not! We came here once right after the war, remember? I just never thought I'd see you here again.
This whole thing is a big secret. We weren't supposed to tell anybody.
I wonder who the others are.
I dunno. I wasn't sure I believed Master Ava when she said others would come. But now that you're here...

Master Ava's Role.Line: What's written in the last page of the Book is gonna happen. The entire world will be lost to darkness. But Master, isn't there anything we can do? Well, that's what brings me to your role. You might just be the only hope of keeping light from expiring.
Hope...? Master, what is it that you need me to do?

Don't get involved in any battles, forget the notions of Unions, find Keyblade wielders with potential...And create an entirely separate organization. Then, like the seeds of a dandelion, let them fly to another world. They will keep the light alive.
You really think that I'm the right person for this?
Ava, you're the ONLY person for this.
And then, after all of that...

The Chosen Five.Line: I'll select four others from the Dandelions. The five of you will each lead a Union, as the five of us have You won't be alone in this. The five of you can work together.

Union Leaders.Line: When all's said and done and only the Dandelions are left, they'll need to lead the Unions.
Is there a need to maintain the Unions?
Of course! Getting rid of them would be like pooh-poohing all your hard work! BEsides, other than the five new Union leaders, no one else is going to know that the world...well, you know.
There's no point for anyone to carry around knowledge of such a catastrophic event. I want everyone to start over in a different world with a clean slate– well, to their knowledge, of course.
Apparently so. Here, take a look at these five names. They're your new recruits. Make them all Dandelions, and when the time comes, teach them their roles.
Why is this one circled in red?
Jackpot! That lucky wielder gets their own free copy of the Book of Prophecies!
Yeah, it's a great read, don't you think? Oh, and it's also needed to shape the world into what it's supposed to be.
Only if the only four get their hands on it. Ava, this book needs t obe handed to its owner in secret. No one else can know.

The Third to Arrive.Line: Welcome! You're number three. I'm Skuld. Nice to meet you.
So, Master Ava talked to you too, huh?
Yeah, she said I should come here when everything was over, and that I was one of the five.
I got the same speech. I'm Ephemer, by the way.

Union Cross.Line: Uh huh. It's hard seeing Player like that... And I hate lying... But I know it's for the best.
It is. And it might be hard, but you're doing a great job.
Chirithy, don't forget about your task.
That's right. New adventures with friends is a great way to bury sad memories deep within one's heart.
And we can't stand to lose anyone now. The darkness in this world is not the same as what we faced in the other one.
It feels more...complex, like there's more to it than meets the eye. Almost like it has its own will.
Don't worry, we'll look into it. In the meantime, you know what your job is. Fill Player in on everything, okay?
What was that about? There's no need to worry anyone until we know for sure what it is.

I know. I'm sorry, but this concerns everyone. I get a really bad feeling every time something happens in this world that didn't happen in the other one. This Union Cross business also feels... off. Something's not right.
But we were told to make it happen. It's in the rules, remember?
I know, but— "May your heart be your guiding key."

Number Four.Line: We cannot avoid the end; not even the Masters, including myself, are likely to survive.
Me? A Master? A Union leader? That's crazy. And what's this nonsense about "the end"?
There isn't much time left. You are the ones who will remain. Someone needs to keep everything and everyone in order. Otherwise, light will expire.
But–
I'll select four others from the Dandelions. The five of you will each lead a Union, as the five of us have You won't be alone in this. The five of you can work together.
The five of us...
You two know each other, huh? Must be nice; I've always been on my own.
I was pretty much on my own too.
I wonder why I was chosen for this. I'm not especially good at anything... And I'm never at the top of the rankings.
I'm sure Master Ava has her reasons.
You think so? I don't know her all that much. I've barely spoken with her.
She's easy to talk to, that's for sure.
You say that about everyone.
Not true!
I sure wish I had friends.
You do! Right here.
Yeah!
Friends. Cool.
You must be number four.
The name's Brain. Pleasure.
Not again...Don't get involved. I know it's frustrating, but you can't fix everything. Everyone seems to have a bone to pick. I hope things don't get any worse...
Player! Wait! We're all on the same side!
Are we? Then why did they steal our Lux?
What are you talking about? We're just trying to protect the light. I'll bet good munny that it's your Union that's fallen into darkness. Traitors!
What did you say!? How can you prove YOU'RE not the traitor!?
Hold on! We're all on the same side! Why are you fighting!?
Mind your own business!
Stop it!
Skuld!
Who are you? Which Union do YOU belong to?
It doesn't matter. Our only enemy is darkness. Our Keyblades aren't meant to harm one another!
Anyone who tries to steal the light is no different than a monster of darkness!
What!?
The war's already begun.
That's right.

We can only place trust in our own Unions. We cannot tell who has fallen into darkness with a mere glance. Why do you fight over Lux? Light is not proof of strength. Victory is proof of strength. And a strong Union is proof of justice.
What?
Do you disagree? Aren't you one of Ava's chosen wielders? One of the Dandelions? You, of all people, should be able to see that she's using her special Union to demonstrate her power.
I don't belong to the Dandelions.
Which Union do you belong to?
Anguis/Leopardos/Unicornis/Ursus/Vulpes.
Stand ready.

Tragic Memories.Line: Where am I...?
Are you okay?
Was it all...a dream?

You've been having that dream a lot since that day. The day Master Ava invited you to join the Dandelions, And you talked to Skuld at the Fountain Square, right before she went off to join them. You looked like you were having a nightmare. Why don't you take it easy today and get some rest?
I think I will. How long was I asleep?
No longer than usual. Goodnight...
There are rules the five of you must obey when you become leaders of your own Unions.
I'm listening, but this whole conversation about the end and leading Unions and all...I'm still trying to wrap my head around it.
As long as you keep listening.
...Okay.
What I need you to do is prepare the other world. I'll be sending all the Dandelions there soon. You'll continue living your lives, but without the impending doom.
So it's like an alternate reality?
Yes. But in order for it to work, the Dandelions will need to forget all about the strife, the war.
So they won't remember any of it?
There's no need for them to remember such a tragedy. It'll simply be a burden. Only the five of you will know the truth. The Chirithy of each wielder will make it happen.
It might be a burden, but isn't it better they remember the past? The past IS what makes the future.
I thought you might say that. But I wonder if you would feel the same if you were there to witness the end.
Thought I'd be the last to arrive. Guess I'm not so lazy after all.
I guess not.
So, you the leader?
No, we haven't decided any of that yet. I think we should wait until we're all here.
You got it. Hey, about the rules, think they're set in stone? Or more like a guideline?
They're rules. Of course they're set in stone.
I get it. You're the serious one. Like Master Ava.
You're not the first person to say that.
I thought you seemed familiar.
But Master Ava's so amazing!
What does that mean?
But seriously, how do we know we can trust her? She's forcing us to lie to everyone, since we're the only ones who're supposed to know the truth.
Yeah, I'm not sure how I feel about it either.
But...
It's all right. You've done enough.
Is it my time...? Skuld...
Player...
We made...a promise...
I didn't forget.
You're late...
I know, I'm sorry.
I thought you might say that. But I wonder if you would feel the same if you were there to witness the end.
Rules are rules. I don't want anyone else to have to carry the burden of the past.
Got it. I trust you'll guide us down the right path.
Same here!
Just one more.

Sorrowful Memories.Line: I heard that people are designed to shove all of their sad memories deep down inside in order to protect their hearts. If that's true... ...was it really necessary to overwrite the memories of all these people? Memories shouldn't be forgotten, even the sad ones. ...Maybe that's easy to say when they don't belong to me. But while they can be hidden deep inside, the wounds and scars remain. Forgetting doesn't mean it never happened. Your memory was overwritten with the rest of them. Your sad memories, forgotten. But your heart still bears the scars. If the time comes when you need to remember... ...I'll be right here by your side to help you. He bestowed names on his six apprentices, and passed down the Book of Prophecies to five who came to be known as the foretellers. The five read the manuscript... ...and were shocked by the final entry. "On that fated land, a great war shall transpire." "Darkness will prevail and the light expire."

The Wielders' Brawl.Line: Not again...Don't get involved. I know it's frustrating, but you can't fix everything. Everyone seems to have a bone to pick. I hope things don't get any worse...
Player! Wait! We're all on the same side!
Are we? Then why did they steal our Lux?
What are  you talking about? We're just trying to protect the light. I'll bet good munny that it's your Union that's fallen into darkness. Traitors!
What did you say!? How can you prove YOU'RE not the traitor!?
Hold on! We're all on the same side! Why are you fighting!?
Mind your own business!
Stop it!
Skuld!
Who are you? Which Union do YOU belong to?
It doesn't matter. Our only enemy is darkness. Our Keyblades aren't meant to harm one another!
Anyone who tries to steal the light is no different than a monster of darkness!
What!?
The war's already begun.
That's right.

We can only place trust in our own Unions. We cannot tell who has fallen into darkness with a mere glance. Why do you fight over Lux? Light is not proof of strength. Victory is proof of strength. And a strong Union is proof of justice.
What?
Do you disagree? Aren't you one of Ava's chosen wielders? One of the Dandelions? You, of all people, should be able to see that she's using her special Union to demonstrate her power.
I don't belong to the Dandelions.
Which Union do you belong to?
Anguis/Leopardos/Unicornis/Ursus/Vulpes.
Stand ready.

An Inevitable Clash.Line: You're not worthy of the Keyblade.
You bring harm to a Keyblade wielder and call yourself a Master?
Hmph! It was merely a test.
Was it? Your hostility is why I'm here.

The war is coming. Invi, Gula, Ava, and even you, Ira– your Unions are all scrambling to gather more Lux than any other. Look around you. The strife has already begun, and you four have done nothing  but fuel the flame.
And you elect to resolve this with brute force?

Ultimately, the strong determine the world's future. While others gather Lux, I will recruit a legion. Backed by a powerful organization, a single leader can maintain the world's balance. The four of you will be banished, and I will lead the Unions in your stead.
You're a fool to think you have that kind of power, Aced. You overestimate yourself.
Then let's settle this on the battlefield!
Master Ira. The battlefield? What's about to happen?
So Master Ava WAS telling the truth.
But...She said there would be no winners. So why fight?
To make certain...there are no winners. Prepare yourselves.

A Vision.Line: Is this...? Who...? What's going on? ! Is that...?

Contemplation.Line: You don't need to thank me. I just can't believe how bad things have gotten. Everywhere I go, people are arguing with each other.
Even the Masters— Well, we all saw what happened.
They used to work together, but now... I don't know how or why, but somehow, things changed.
Then I suppose there really is no escaping the war.

Not yet, but I know he's somewhere carrying out Master Ava's wishes. As for me, I'm trying to convince people not to take part in the battle to come. But most of them don't even believe that a war is coming. What's more... ...Master Ava's absence is causing the Dandelions to lose their focus.
No one's seen her around lately. Maybe Master Gula knows something. The two were close.
Then let's go talk to him.

Master Gula's Belief.Line: It should be. I heard Master Gula is seen around here more than the tower. This is it, but I don't know if he's here.
A wielder who's not out collecting Lux. That must make you a Dandelion.

Why? To ask her if she can do something so we can avoid the war? Not even she has the power to do that. Or do you plan on asking her what's going on? Knowing won't change anything. There's nothing you can do.
But I can't just sit back and wait for the end to come. I need to warn people what's coming. That's my role as a Dandelion.
I can see why she chose you. You're just like her. Always doing the right thing. But doing the right thing can't save the world. Only the Master has that kind of power.
Chirithy must've told you about him. The five of us foretellers were disciples of the Master of Masters. If anyone has a shot at changing anything, it's him.
I knew you'd ask. But I don't know, he just disappeared one day. Me and Ava searched for him, but he vanished without a trace. There's only one person who might know where he is— Luxu.
The Master of Master's sixth disciple. After the Master disappeared, so did Master Luxu.
So you don't know where Master Luxu is either?
I knew that was coming too. You really are just like Ava.
Looking for Luxu? Yeah. In order to find the Master.

Luxu's Role.Line: What have you been doing all this time?
What did the Master ask you to do?
I wasn't given a copy of the Book like the five of you. Instead, I need to make my way to the future as written in that book. I'll witness the end of this world and go on to the next.
You're searching for a way to avoid the war, right? That's why you were looking for me, hoping I could lead you to the Master. Sorry, but I can't help you. This world is meant to end.
What's written on the Lost Page... ... the page none of you have in your Books. The page on which the Master's intentions are inscribed.
His intentions? Are you implying that he wanted this? This chaos...this war?

My role is to carry the secret with me. And to do that, events need to play out just as they're written on that page. The Master isn't interested in this world and what's to come. He's observing, doing what it takes for me to fulfill my role.
Tell me, what's written on that page? Luxu, are you responsible for all of this?  Are you...are you the traitor?

The Barrens.Line: I couldn't hear anything that was being said. I didn't know what was about to happen, what was about to unfold in front of us. The intensity in the air was overwhelming. Images and sounds were burned into my brain. There was no time to stop and think about why we were fighting– why our enemies were no longer monsters, but each other. Our friends. But no matter how hopeless the situation, people will cling to the last shred of hope, the last piece of their dream, until the very end. It's not over. Not yet.

As the Bells Toll.Line: Tell me, what's written on that page? Luxu, are you responsible for all of this?  Are you...are you the traitor?
"Imbalance observed, strength misplaced, a future filled with sorrow. "Words of truth misunderstood as they explore the secret of tomorrow."
The Lost Page. Who could this be pointing to?
You asked for the truth, so there it is. Now that you know who the traitor is, can you accept it?

Then follow your fate and fight. If there's another solution, it'll become apparent after the war is over. Has it occurred to you that maybe the Master wasn't so concerned about the world's future... ...but how we, his disciples, would let our hearts guide us?
Are you saying his interest was in US all along? That's ridiculous! Luxu, you're interpreting the Master's words in your own way. This can't be what he wanted!
Why are you telling us this?
The traitor is the catalyst for the events that lead to the world's end.
I thought I knew who it was, but I couldn't stop them. And who knows? I could've been wrong.
"Words of truth misunderstood as they explore the secret of tomorrow." What could it mean?
There's more. "With a single strike, toll the bells and herald the end... "... bringing war upon us, as fate did intend."
Are you allowed to tell us about such a significant passage from the Book?
No. But does it even matter? Knowing what I told you won't change anything. And there it is.
You should head back. Your Union leaders will probably call for an assembly.

Nightmares Projected.Line: I'm going to go join the other Dandelions. Won't you come with me? I understand. But please, don't take part in the war. I want you to come with us to the world outside. Ephemer would want that too. Think about it. Thanks. I'll see you soon.
Are you sure? Okay. Let's go home.
Chirithy.
What is it?
What happens to you if I disappear?
You'd disappear too?
Mhm.
Oh. What do you think I should do?
I don't want you to fight. I know the foretellers didn't intend for us to be friends, and it might be against the rules, but here we are. And as your friend, I don't want you to disappear.
Thank you.
Oh? Not taking part in the fun?
Are you gonna become a Dandelion and fly away?
Stop it. The Dandelions aren't running away.
Right, they're keeping light alive by passing it down to future wielders. It sounds noble, but aren't they really just leaving their friends behind?
Who are you?
Before we get to that... Did you know that with that bangle of yours, you've not only been collecting dark energy, but using it for your own needs?
What?
That bangle gave you strength. Didn't you ever wonder where that was coming from?
I don't believe you.
Don't look so worried. Our Master wanted this, don't you know?
You're wrong. That bangle was meant to collect dark energy so it could be transformed into light.
Then why am I here? Why do I exist? The Master knew all along what would happen.
Now, to answer your question from before. I was born from your darkness. I belong to you.
That's not true!!
Why would I lie about this? I suppose that unlike Chirithy there, I'm not always by your side, and I act of my own will.
What are you doing!?
Since you're not participating in the war, I'll show you a dream you'll never forget.
No!
What?
If you do belong to him, why are you doing this?
Unlike you Spirits, we Nightmares exist to plant bad dreams. That's how we sever our bond and gain freedom.
Spirits? And Nightmares...?

A Clash Foretold Pt. 1.Line: You! I deemed you unworthy. What you lack in potential, I see you make up for in courage. I could use someone like you in my Union. How unexpected! You've proven me wrong. You are indeed worthy! But that also means you pose a threat. And that is why you must disappear! Ira!

A Clash Foretold Pt. 2.Line: I'm sorry for dragging you into this. I'll make this quick. I'm impressed, Aced/Ava/Gula/Ira. You did well with this one. You must make it through this.

A Clash Foretold Pt. 3.Line: Hey, it's you. You don't look so good. Are you okay? All right. Here we go.
You're on a battlefield, you gotta fight. You're a lot tougher than I thought! Lucky for you, I'm not in the mood for a real fight. Maybe I'll see you around.

A Clash Foretold Pt. 4.Line: I've been looking for you. Master Ava, why are you here? I thought you'd be guiding the wielders away– !
Some things aren't for you to know. Listen to me: you must join the Dandelions and go far, far away from here.

Let's Go.Line: You did great. You can rest now, okay?
I know, but I'm here now. Let's go.

Into the Corridor of Darkness.Line: What a relaxing day! I wish every day could be like this.
You. I need your help. The market warehouse. Now.
I wonder what's going on. Let's find out!

Thanks for being here. Sorry that I couldn't explain things earlier. My friends cornered a new breed of Heartless in the warehouse. They've been in there for a while, and I'm started to get worried. Would you check on them for me?

Chasing the Heartless.Line: Player! Darkness has spread to a new world. I'll bet that's where it's going!

A Beautiful Melody.Line: Oh, hello. It's nice to meet you. I'm Phillip. Out for a stroll? Oh, of course– you must have heard that enchanting sound, too. It's beautiful...What is it? Come on, let's find out!
Ah-ha! There they are. You know what to do!

Once Upon a Dream.Line: Don't you remember? We've met before.
Why, of course. You said so yourself...Once upon a dream.
Whoa, whoa! Where do you think you're going? It doesn't look like they're in any danger for now. Let's give them some time alone.
This is just like in my dream.
Who are you? What's your name?
My name? Why, it's...it's...Oh no, no, I can't, I– Goodbye!
But when will I see you again?
At the cottage, in the glen.
You know, maybe the Heartless aren't after him. Maybe they're after her. She might be– Er, never mind that. Let's go and see if she's all right.

A Familiar Foe.Line: Thank you so much for saving me! I'm sorry, but I must go. Goodbye!
There! I know you're worried about her, but I think you should deal with this problem first. What do you say?

The Three Fairies.Line: Your power must be magic. Are you one of HER minions?
Now, be nice. She saved us. Thank you, dear. We're very grateful. I'm Fauna.
And my name is Flora. We know that you're not here to hurt anyone. Hmm-hmm...Don't you have something to say, Merryweather?
Right. Now, we don't have much time. WE're getting ready for a most important birthday party.
And a lovely dress. Hurry, ears, there's still so much to do!
A party and a cake and a dress? They must be awfully busy in there! Huh? Why is it so quiet all of a sudden? Look!
Why, hello again. I'm terribly sorry about before. I was in such a hurry. Won't you come in? Perhaps you'd like some tea.

A Royal Secret.Line: Aunt Flora, Fauna, Merryweather! Where is everybody?
Oh, you darlings! This is the happiest day of my life. Why, everything's so wonderful. Just wait till you meet him.
Oh, he's not a stranger. We've met before.
Why? After all, I am sixteen.
Since the day you were born.
But that's impossible! How could I marry a prince? I'd have to be–
Princess Aurora. Tonight, we're taking you back to your father, King Stefan.
But–but, I can't! He's coming here tonight. I promised to meet him.
I'm sorry, child, but you must never see that young man again.
Oh, no, no! I can't believe it. No, no!

The Curse.Line: I'm sorry. I shouldn't have suspected you of working for her.

You see, dear, when Princess Aurora was just a baby, she was cursed by the evil fairy Maleficent. Before the sun sets on her sixteenth birthday, the princess would prick her finger on the spindle of a spinning wheel...and die.
But Merryweather had one last gift that we could give to the baby. So, Merryweather cast a spell of her own.

Oh, let me see if I remember it exactly..."Sweet Princess, if through this wicked witch's trick a spindle should your finger prick, a ray of hope there still may be in this gift I give to thee. Not in death, but just in sleep the fateful prophecy you'll keep, and from this slumber you shall wake when True Love's Kiss the spell shall break." Yes, that was it.
We called her Briar Rose to hide her from Maleficent. And we came here to this cottage and raised her as our own.
Today is her sixteenth birthday, and we must bring her back to her parents. We've kept her safe all these years...But now these monsters have appeared.
Would you help us protect her, dear? We mustn't use our magic out in the open like this or Maleficent might find us.
Now remember, we're counting on you.

Return to the Castle.Line: We can take it from here.
We'll make sure she gets to the castle safely.
Hmm, do you think it's a good idea to let them go off on their own? I've had a bad feeling since the moment we set foot in this world. I think...it's somehow connected to Maleficent. Good idea!

Green Glow.Line: Now dear, if you'll just sit here. This one last gift, dear child, for thee...the symbol of thy royalty. A crown to wear in grace and beauty...as is thy right and royal duty.
Come, let her have a few moments alone.
Thank goodness, it's you! We need your help.

Hindering Heartless.Line: And just who are you? You dare get in my way? Well, we'll see about that!

A Deep Slumber.Line: Rose! Don't touch anything! You musn't!
Touch the spindle. Touch it, I say!
You poor simple fools. Thinking you could defeat me, the Mistress of All Evil! Well, here's your precious princess! Ah-ha-ha-ha!
Oh, Rose! I'll never forgive myself.
We're all to blame...Poor King Stefan and the Queen.
They'll be heartbroken when they find out.
They're not going to. We'll put them ALL to sleep...until Rose awakens. Thank you for all you've done, dear. Now, you'd best leave the castle; there's nothing more to be done here. Come along.
I know you're disappointed. But I can still sense her light. She may be asleep, but her heart isn't. But...there's nothing we can do for her. Not right now. We'll come back to help her, okay?

I Shall Have Revenge.Line: Oh, boy! Did ya see that, kupo? Did ya? Huh? Did ya!? I defeated it all by myself! I didn't need anyone's help! I've got this new mission in the bag, kupo! Huh? What? What is it, kupo? *scream* Y-you'll help me? Thanks! I owe ya one!

The Beach.Line: Sorry...We were just, uh, warming up before the mission. Right, kupo? Let's keep what happened back there between us. They'd be mad if they knew I was doing stuff on my own.
Calm down, guys. The boat should be here any minute. Just remember, we're a team. Don't forget that.
Hey, guys. Huh? Why haven't you changed yet?
Because we didn't want to look silly! We'll change when we get there.
Where? Why are you dressed like that? Where're we going, kupo?
No one told you? This is Operation: Let's Enjoy the Beach While Completing Our Mission.
That's the best you could come up with...?
The name is lousy, but he's right.
Why didn't anyone tell me, kupo? I'll get my things!
You'd better hurry, or we'll leave without you!
Same goes for you. Pack your things if you haven't already.

Preparations.Line: Let's get this over with. Quickly.
You two know why we're here...don't you?

An Important Mission.Line: Yep! Time for Operation: Fun in the Sun!
You guys too, huh? Hate to break up the party, but you can't swim here. It's off-limits.
A vicious monster is what happened. I came with my friends, but– Anyway, go home. You shouldn't be here.
You're going home, just like that? We've been in bad situations before. We can handle this one too. What do you say?

Dangerous Waters.Line: Nope! Maybe he was just trying to scare us.

Secret Admirer.Line: This is my favorite spot that nobody knows about. It belongs to me, Strelitzia. These past two years, I fought darkness to protect the light. I made friends, but I also had to say goodbye. I saw new party members come and go. Only a few of my friends from the beginning are still around. A lot has changed over time, but there's always been one constant in my life—you. I first saw you at Fountain Square. You were waiting for someone, but they never came. When I returned from my mission that day, you were still there—waiting. You looked so disappointed. I saw your eyes well up as you hugged Chirithy. Since that day, I began to see you everywhere. It was strange because we must've crossed paths so many times before... But I didn't really notice you until that day. I wanted to say hi... but I could never muster up the courage. While everyone else was going about their days without question, you began to doubt your mission, your purpose. You saw there was something more, something we weren't being told. You don't know me, but I feel like I know you. I hope that one day we can be friends. There's so much I'd like to tell you.
I need to ask a favor. It's something only you—a Dandelion—can help me with.
I need you to listen carefully. It won't be long before this world—

I Need to Tell You.Line: Yes. But it's also a great responsibility.
I have faith in Master Ava.
Me too. But what she said about the world... Could that be true?
It's a scary thought, isn't it?
Only the Dandelions will survive. That means everyone else will disappear.
I suppose you're right. But your friends are all Dandelions. Why are you so worried?
They are, but what about everyone else?
I know you care. But what do you think would happen if you told everyone the truth? The world is nearing its end, and the foretellers will disappear. No one would believe you.

Chirithy:Whoa!.Line: Wha—? Who? Oh, that Keyblade wielder you're always watching.
I have to tell him! But how will I find him? It's so dark out. What can I do...?
Hello? Are you okay? What? I thought—?
I'm going to wake up early and wait for him at Fountain Square.
But Master Ava told you not to say a word to anyone.
I'm gonna recruit him to the Dandelions. I won't say a word about anything else. Goodnight!
I'm not sure I like this!
Good news! I saw him over there.
H-hey, wait for me! A Union leader? ...Really? Strelitzia, wait!

One Last Wish.Line: He/she has to be here. This is the only place we haven't checked.
Maybe my eyes were playing tricks on me.
Well, it was worth a shot. I'll head back to Fountain Square.
I'm sorry. This is all my fault...
I wish... I'd had the courage.

Number Five.Line: How much longer are they gonna be?
I'm gonna take a look around.
I hope I didn't keep you waiting.
Well, you did. How do you plan on making it up to us, Number Five?
Number Five? Then I must be the last one.
Don't worry about it. I'm Ephemer!
I apologize for making you wait. I was searching for something and time got away from me. My name is Lauriam. It's nice to meet you all.

Devourer of Nightmares.Line: So this is the Master's room.
Why not? It's ours now, isn't it?
We should decide on Union leaders.
About that... I don't know if we should be assigning people just yet.
We should keep the five Unions as they are for now. As for who goes where, we'll need to discuss it in length.
Exactly. I don't want people being loyal to only their own Unions.
Doesn't the rulebook say we need to assign new leaders?
Yes, but it doesn't state when.
Got it. No need to hurry then.
It's an important decision. We'll need to think long and hard.
Sure, if that's what everyone else wants to do.
You can speak up if you don't agree.
It's not that. I'm still not sure about leading my own Union. At least if we all put a lot of thought into it, I'll feel more confident about the whole thing.
You're not weak, Ven. You're kind.
Then it's settled. Oh, and to avoid any confusion or chaos, let's not say a word about the foretellers to anyone just yet.
That's wise. As planned, all the Keyblade wielders are undergoing their training again. It may be a good time to discuss the issue when that's over with.
Change of subject. I think I found our first task.
Yep. What better way to celebrate our own promotion than by granting everyone their own companion?
Someone that'll come along for the ride, like Chirithy. Spirits don't have as many powers as Chirithy, but they can devour nightmares.
Uh huh. It's hard seeing Player like that... And I hate lying... But I know it's for the best.
It is. And it might be hard, but you're doing a great job.
So they can forget about the past...
That's right. If every wielder has one of these Spirits, the tragedy will be forgotten in no time. Problem solved.
But do we even know how?
We can make one using an archetype, but... Hmmm... I'll need materials. I'll stay here and get things started. You guys are going on a scavenger hunt.
I'm sorry, but I'll have to pass.
Then help me out with this.

A New Partner.Line: Huh? Owww! What was that for?
I have a present for you! A little thank you for all your hard work. Dun dada duuun! It's your very own Spirit!
This little one'll join you on your adventure. Play nice, okay?

The Golden Scarab.Line: Are you sure you want to do this? That man offered a handsome reward for the other half of that golden scarab. A VERY handsome reward. Something's fishy. Maybe Aladdin knows something. Oh! Here he comes! Good luck!
Do you have it? Quickly! Follow the trail!

The Cave of Wonders.Line: At last, after all my years of searching...The Cave of Wonders
Now, remember...You must bring me the lamp.
Who disturbs my slumber? Know this. Only one may enter here. Only whose worth lies far within. A diamond in the rough.
What are you waiting for? Go on!
Seek thee out...The diamond in the rough.
I can't believe it. What're we gonna do now? We're never gonna get a hold of that stupid lamp!
I must find this one. This...diamond in the rough.
I told you something fishy was going on! Anyway, that's that. Say, while we're here, why don't we go see Aladdin?

Much Needed Rest.Line: It's getting dark. Let's call it a day. Good morning, sleepyhead! Ready to start the day?

Princess Jasmine.Line: Who are you? I demand an answer.
We gotta help her, Abu! Come on! Are you all right?
Yes, thank you. May I know who I'm thank–?
Do you trust me? This way!

Diamond in the Rough.Line: Part, sands of time. Reveal to me the one who can enter the Cave. Yes, yes! There he is. My diamond in the rough! Let's have the guards extend him an invitation to the palace, shall we?
Yes, just me and Abu. We come and go as we please.
Well, it's not much, but it's got a great view. The palace looks pretty amazing, huh?
What does it matter? I ran away and I am NOT going back.
My father's forcing me to get married.
Here you are! It's the dungeon for you, boy!
Unhand him. By order of the princess.
Do as I command. Release him.
Ah...I would, Princess, except my orders come from Jafar. You'll have to take it up with him.

Aladdin's Been Caught!.Line: I wonder what they're so happy about.
You wanna know why we're celebrating? 'Cause we finally caught that street rat, Aladdin. Now he's where he belongs– behind bars.
Aladdin's always tried to help the people of this town. What could've happened? Let's go to Aladdin's house to see if we can figure this out!

Oh, it's you. Aladdin's luck finally ran out. He was spotted with Princess Jasmine. He's been charged with kidnapping the princess. No way it was a misunderstanding. He was caught red-handed. It'll be almost impossible for him to wiggle his way out of this one. He's been sentenced. If you have any last words, now's the time. Ask my friend at the guard station for more information.  That's the monkey that was with him. Take him with you, will ya?

I was wondering when you'd get here. You and Aladdin have been through a lot. Figured you'd show up. He was captured by order of the royal vizier, Jafar. Don't tell my boss, but there's still time. If you wanna see Aladdin, there's a secret passage in the bazaar warehouse. It leads straight to the dungeon. But be careful– it's swarming with those monsters.

The Cave's Treasures.Line: She was the princess. I can't believe it. Abu! Help me outta these. Don't worry, Abu. I'll never see her again. I'm a street rat, remember, and there's a law. She's gotta marry a prince. I'm a...I'm a fool.
You're only a fool if you give up, boy.
A lowly prisoner, like yourself. But together, perhaps we can be more.
There is a cave, boy. A cave of wonders. Filled with treasures beyond your wildest dreams. Treasure enough to impress even your princess, I'd wager.
But the law says only a prince can marry–
You've heard of the golden rule, haven't you, boy? Whoever has the gold makes the rules. Ha ha ha!
So why would  you share all of this wonderful treasure with me?
I need a young man with strong legs and a strong back...to go after it.
Uh, one problem. It's out there. We're in here.
Things aren't always what they seem. So, do we have a deal?
Is that the cave from before? Then Aladdin might need our help. Let's go!

Into the Cave of Wonders.Line: Proceed. Touch nothing but the lamp.
Remember boy– first fetch me the lamp...and then you shall have your reward.

Oh, hey! What are you doing out here? The cave's dangerous? Aw, don't worry. I just need to find one lamp. I'll be back before ya know it. I gotta do it. It's the only way I can become good enough for Jasmine. You'll come along? Aw, that's great! Thanks!
Well!? I don't have all day. Fetch me that lamp!

The Magic Carpet.Line: What is it? A magic carpet? Come on out. We're not gonna hurt ya. Have you been here a long time? Maybe you can help us. You see, we're trying to find this lamp. I think he knows where it is.

Fire and Ice.Line: I sure am glad you're here. Ready?

The Magic Lamp.Line: It has to be up ahead. Let's go. Okay. Wait here. This is it? This is what we came all the way down here to– Abu! No!
You have touched the forbidden treasure. Now you will never see the light of day!
I can't hold on. Give me your hand!
First give me the lamp! Ha ha ha! Yes! At last! Ha ha ha! Have your reward. Your eternal reward! Finally! The lamp is mine! It's all mine! I– Where is it!? No...No!!!

Genie of the Lamp.Line: Player. Player. Player! Phew! I was worried. Are you okay? It looks like we lost Aladdin and Abu. Let's see if we can find them.

Ohhh...It's you...What happened? That's right. We're trapped. That two-faced son of a jackal! That man, whoever he was...He's long gone with that lamp. Abu! Why, you hairy little thief! Looks like such a beat-up, worthless piece of junk. Hey, I think there's something written here, but it's hard to make out.
Oy! Ten-thousand years will give ya such a crick in the neck! Wow, does it feel good to be outta there! Hi, where ya from? What's your name?
Sorry, not you. The guy with the lamp. Kind of a lamp-genie priority thing.
I must have hit my head harder than I thought.
Say...You're a lot smaller than my last master.

That's right! That's right! That's right! That's right! That's right! That's right! What do you wish of me, the ever-impressive, the long-contained, often imitated but never duplicated Genie of the Lamp!? Right here direct from the lamp, right here for your very much wish fulfillment.
You're gonna grant me any three wishes I want?
Uh, almost. There are a few provisos, a couple of quid pro quos.
Provisos? You mean limitations? On wishes? Some all-powerful genie. I don't know, Abu. He probably can't even get us out of this cave. Looks like we're gonna have to find a way out of here.
Excuse me? You're gettin' your wishes, so sit down! Keep your hands and arms inside the carpet. We're...outta here!

Jafar's Plan.Line: Jafar, this is an outrage! From now on, you're to discuss sentencing of prisoners with me, before they are beheaded.
I assure you, Your Highness, it won't happen again.
Jasmine, Jafar. Now let's put this whole messy business behind us. Please?
My most abject and humblest apologies to you as well, Princess.
At least some good will come of my being forced to marry. When I am queen, I will have the power to get rid of you.
That's nice. All settled then. Now, Jasmine, getting back to this suitor business. Jasmine!
If only I had gotten that lamp! Hmph. If she finds a husband...she'll have us banished!
Oh! Wait a minute! Wait a minute...Jafar? What if you were her husband?
You marry the princess. Then, uh...you become the sultan!
Oh! Marry the shrew. I become sultan. The idea has merit! Hahaha!

The First Wish.Line: How about that, Mr. Doubting Mustafa?
Whoa, you sure showed me. Now, about my three wishes–
Dost mine ears deceive me? Three? You are down by one, boy!
Uh, no. I never actually wished to get out of the cave. You did that on your own.
Oh, I feel just sheepish. All right, but no more freebies.
Fair deal. So, three wishes. Hmm...I want them to be good. What would  you wish for?
Me? No one's ever asked me that before. Well, in my case...Ah, forget it.
What? Tell me.

Freedom. Being a prisoner is all part and parcel of the whole genie gig. Phenomenal cosmic powers– itty-bitty living space. Oh, but to be free...To be my own master. Such a thing would be greater than all the magic and all the treasure in all the world! But what am I talking about? It's not gonna happen.
Why not?
The only way I get outta this is if my master wishes me out. So you can guess how often that's happened.
I'll do it. I'll set you free. I promise. After I make my first two wishes, I'll use my third wish to set you free.
Well, here's hopin'. All right, let's make some magic! What is it you want most?
Well, there's this girl...She's smart and fun and beautiful! But she's the princess. To even have a chance, I'd have to be– Hey! Can you make me a prince?
Well, was that an official wish? Say the magic words!
Genie, I wish for you to make me a prince!
All right! You're a prince! Complete with turban, feathers and...Look– shoes!
Wow, thanks, Genie! This– this is incredible! Now I just gotta convince Jasmine. Hey, thanks for your help, too, Player! Well, wish me luck!
I guess it's true what they say– love does give you tunnel vision. Remember that, kid.

You were awfully quiet back there. I guess it was hard to get a word in edgewise. You want to make sure things work out for Aladdin? You do seem genuinely worried about him. I'm kind of curious about the princess myself. Why don't we go to Agrabah? If only you'd spoken up sooner! We would've gotten a free ride. Oh, well. See you there!

Prince Ali Ababwa.Line: You will order the princess to marry me.
I will order...the princess to...What? What is that? That music!
Your Majesty...I have journeyed from afar to seek your daughter's hand.
Prince Ali Ababwa! Of course. I'm delighted to meet you. This is my royal vizier, Jafar. He's delighted, too.
Whatever. You cannot just parade in here uninvited and expect too–
But Jafar, this is a very impressive youth...and a prince besides. If we're lucky, you won't have to marry Jasmine after all.
Nonsense. One thing I pride myself on, Jafar, I'm an excellent judge of character. Well. Jasmine will like this one!
And I'm pretty sure I'll like Princess Jasmine!
Your Highness, no! I must intercede on Jasmine's behalf. This boy is no different from the others. What makes him think he is worthy of the princess?
Your Majesty, I'm Prince Ali Ababwa! Just let her meet me. I will win your daughter!
How dare you! All of you, standing around deciding my future! I am not a prize to be won!
Oh, dear. Don't worry, Prince Ali. Just give Jasmine time to cool down.
I think it's time to say good-bye to Prince Abooboo.

A Wonderful Night.Line: Just the person I was looking for. Take a look at this. I bought a pot at the market, and I think it might be haunted! It shakes and rattles on its own. I'm scared to go inside my own home. Help! –North East Resident. We've been getting similar reports from all over town. See what it's about, will you? Be careful out there.
Those monsters are popping up everywhere! The latest report is from the west alleyway near Aladdin's house. Can I depend on you to take care of it?
Where'd he go? Look! A new message! What looks to be the biggest monster of all attacked a caravan in the Scarab Sands. Take the desert bridge and get out here ASAP! –Guards
What took ya so long!? The monster's up ahead!
We'll hold this place down. You take care of the menace!
What am I gonna do? Jasmine won't even let me talk to her. I should have known I couldn't pull off this stupid prince wish.
All right, Sparky, here's the deal. Tell her the TRUTH!
No way! If Jasmine found out I was really some crummy street rat, she'd laugh at me. I gotta be smooth, cool, confident. How do I look? Princess Jasmine?
Who's there?
It's me, Prince Ali. Ahem...Prince Ali Ababwa.
I do not want to see you.
No, no, please, Princess. Give me a chance.
Just leave me alone. Wait. Do I know you?
Uh, no. No.
You remind me of someone I met in the marketplace.
The marketplace? I have servants who go to the marketplace for me. It couldn't have been me you met.
No, I guess not.
Um, Princess Jasmine? You're very...beautiful.
I'm rich too, you know. The daughter of a sultan. A fine prize for any prince to marry.
Uh, right. Right. A prince like me.
Right, a prince like you. And every other stuffed shirt, swaggering peacock I've met! You're no different than the rest of them!
What?
Just go jump off a balcony!
Uh...You're right. You aren't just some prize to be won. You should be free to make your own choice. I'll go now.

________________.Line: No!
What? What?
How– How are you doing that?
It's a magic carpet.
It's lovely
You, uh, you don't want to go for a ride, do you? We could get out of the palace. See the world.
Is it safe?
Sure. Do you trust me?
What?
Do you trust me?
Yes. It's all so magical.
Yeah.
It's a shame Abu had to miss this.
Nah. He hates fireworks. He doesn't really like flying, either. That is...Oh, no!
You are the boy from the market! I knew it. Why did you lie to me?
Jasmine, I'm sorry.
Did you think I was stupid?
No!
That I wouldn't figure it out?
No! I mean, I hoped you wouldn't. No, that's not what I meant.
Who are you? Tell me the truth!
The truth? The truth is...I, uh, I sometimes dress as a commoner, um...to escape the pressures of palace life. But I really am a prince!
Why didn't you just tell me?
Well, you know, um, royalty going out into the city in disguise...It sounds a little strange, don't you think?
Not that strange. Goodnight, my handsome prince.
Sleep well, Princess. For the first time in my life...things are starting to go right.
Hold him!
I'm afraid you've worn out your welcome, Prince Abooboo. Make sure he's never found.

The Second Wish.Line: Al? Al! Kid, snap out of it! I can't help you unless you make a wish. You have to say "Genie, I want you to save my life." Got it? C'mon, Aladdin! I'll take that as a yes. Don't you scare me like that!
Genie, I...Uh...Thanks, Genie. Hey, you're here, too! Jafar wanted me out of the way. Whatever he's up to...it can't be good.
Only one way to find out, Al.
Yep, we're going back to Agrabah. You're coming with me, right?
Now that that's settled...Away we go!

A Plan Exposed.Line: Oh, Father! I just had the most wonderful time. I'm so happy!
You should be, Jasmine. I have chosen a husband for you. You will wed...Jafar.
I will never marry you. Father, I choose Prince Ali!
Better check your crystal ball again, Jafar.
Tell them the truth, Jafar. You tried to have me killed.
What? Ridiculous nonsense, Your Highness. He is obviously lying.
Your Highness, Jafar's been controlling you with this!
Your Majesty, all of this can be explained.
Well, that's it, we're dead. Just dig a grave for both of us.
This is not done yet, boy!
Jasmine, take your father and hide.

The Master, Jafar.Line: Jasmine and Aladdin...I mean, Prince Ali. I hear there's going to be an official announcement. If only it were a real happy ending. When you think about it, Jasmine's marrying someone that doesn't really exist. I know, it's not all Aladdin's fault. But he needs to tell her the truth. You're right. He might need some help coming clean. C'mon!
Huzzah! Aladdin, you've just won the heart of the princess! What are you gonna do next? Psst, your line is "I'm going to free the genie."
Genie...I can't.
Sure you can. You just go, "Genie, I wish you free."

I'm serious. Look, I'm sorry. I really am. But the only reason anyone thinks I'm worth anything is because of you. What if they find out I'm not really a prince? What if Jasmine finds out? I'd lose her. Genie, I can't keep this up on my own. I...I can't wish you free.
Fine. I understand. After all, you've lied to everyone else. Hey, I was beginning to feel left out. Now, if you'll excuse me, Master.
Genie, I'm really sorry...*sigh* What am I doing? Genie's right. I gotta tell Jasmine the truth.
Ali. Oh, Ali, will you come here?
Jasmine? Where are you?
Out in the menagerie. Hurry. Boy, Jafar's gonna be happy to see you!
People of Agrabah. My daughter has finally chosen a suitor!
Jasmine?
Ali! Where have you been?
Jasmine, there's something I've got to tell you.
The whole kingdom has turned out for Father's announcement.
May I present to you...Prince Ali Ababwa!
Look at them...Cheering that little pipsqueak.
Let them cheer.
You know, Al, I'm getting really– I don't think you're him.
I am your master now. Genie, grant me my first wish. I wish to rule on high, as sultan!
Something tells me this isn't part of the celebration. Come on!

Who is Prince Ali?.Line: Thanks to my second wish, I am now the most powerful sorcerer in the world! Now, Princess, say hello to your precious "Prince Ali"!
Insignificant pest. Very well, I shall take care of both of you! Be gone!

Back to Agrabah.Line: You're lucky you landed on snow! I don't see Aladdin anywhere. I hope he's all right. Let's go find him before he turns into an icicle!

I'm sorry for dragging you into this mess. Where do I start? This is all my fault. I was afraid to tell Jasmine the truth. Then, I really disappointed Genie. And now I've let Jafar get his hands on Genie's lamp! He used the lamp's powers and made a wish to take over the kingdom. I hope Jasmine and the sultan are okay. Wait. Where are we? We better find the Magic Carpet and head back to Agrabah before it's too late. I've got to set things right. Am I glad to see you! We don't have much time. Can you take us to Agrabah? Are you ready?

Jasmine's in Trouble.Line: My dear...With you as my queen–
Hmm. Genie, I have decided to make my final wish. I wish for Princess Jasmine to fall desperately in love with me. It is time you disappeared for good!

Genie Jafar.Line: You thought you could defeat the most powerful being on earth? Without the Genie, boy...You're nothing!
The Genie...The Genie! The Genie has more power than you'll ever have!
He gave you your power, he can take it away!
Al, what are you doing? Why are you bringing me into this?
Face it, Jafar. You're still second best!
You're right. His power does exceed my own. But not for long! I make my third wish! I wish to be an all-powerful genie!
All right, your wish is my command. Way to go, Al.

The Third Wish.Line: Yes! Yes! The power! The absolute power! The universe is mine to command, to control!
Not so fast, Jafar! Aren't you forgetting something? You wanted to be a genie, you got it! And everything that goes with it!
What!?
Phenomenal cosmic powers, itty-bitty living space!
No! No!
Ten thousand years in a Cave of Wonders ought to chill him out!
Jasmine...I'm sorry I lied to you about being a prince.
I know why you did.
Well...I guess...this is good-bye.
Oh, that stupid law. This isn't fair. I love you.
Al, no problem. You've still got one wish left. Just say the word and you're a prince again.
But Genie, what about your freedom?
Hey, it's only an eternity of servitude. This is love.
Jasmine, I do love you. But I gotta stop pretending to be something I'm not.
I understand.
Genie, I wish for your freedom. Genie, you're free!
I'm free. I'm free! Whoa! I'm free! I'm hittin' the road. I'm off to see the world!
Genie, I'm– I'm gonna miss you.
Me too, Al. No matter what anybody says, you'll always be a prince to me.
That's right! You've certainly proven your worth as far as I'm concerned. It's that law that's the problem.
Father?
Well, am I sultan or am I sultan? From this day forth, the princess shall marry whomever she deems worthy.
Him! I choose you, Aladdin.
Call me Al.
Pretending to be someone you're not never leads to happiness. It's something we all need to remember. Even me.

To the Cottage.Line: We need your help! The stranger Rose met in the forest– it was Prince Phillip!
Come on! We have to get to the cottage!

The Witch is Back.Line: She must have taken him to the Forbidden Mountain!

Captured.Line: Oh, come now, Prince Phillip. Why so melancholy? A wondrous future lies before you. You, the destined hero of a charming fairy tale come true. Behold, King Stefan's castle...And in yonder, topmost tower, dreaming of her true love, the princess Aurora. But see the gracious whim of fate. Why, 'tis the selfsame peasant maid, who won the heart of our noble prince but yesterday. She is indeed more wondrous fair. Gold of sunshine in her hair. Lips that shame the red, red rose. In ageless sleep, she finds repose. The years roll by, but a hundred years to a steadfast heart but a day. And now the gates of the dungeon part, and our prince is free to go his way.Off he rides on his noble steed, a valiant figure, straight and tall, to wake his love with love's first kiss...and prove that true love conquers all! A-hahahahaha!

A Dangerous Road.Line: Wait, Prince Phillip. The road to true love may be barred by still many more dangers, which you alone will have to face.
You want to go with him?
Very well. Arm thyself...with this enchanted Shield of Virtue...and this mighty Sword of Truth. For these weapons of righteousness will triumph over evil. Now, we must hurry!

Spell of Thorns.Line: A forest of thorns shall be his tomb...Borne through the skies on a fog of doom. Now go with a curse and serve me well! 'Round Stefan's castle cast by spell!

To the Castle.Line: That's Maleficent! Prince Phillip's in trouble. Let's hurry!

The Power of Darkness.Line: Now shall you deal with me, oh Prince...and all the powers of evil!

The Sword of Truth.Line: Now, Sword of Truth, fly swift and sure... ...that evil die and good endure!

True Love.Line: The princess was in a deep slumber, only to be awoken by true love. It's a strong and wonderful power... ...like the heart's light.

Reunion: Belle of the Ball.Line: You came back! Oh, I'm so glad. Now I can tell you about the castle library. It's filled with more books than you can even imagine! There are wonderful stories of faraway places that I've only dreamed of visiting.
We'll make those dreams come true, Belle.
Really? Since I've come to the castle, I've learned that the world is filled with magic and wondrous adventures. I hope you get to experience them some day, too.

Reunion: Dreams Come True.Line: It's you! Wanna see Cinderelly? No more mean Stepmuddy. Cinderelly happy. Jaq happy too. Go. Say hi!
You must be the one I've heard so much about. Thank you for all you've done.
Yes, I'm so grateful. I don't think I would be here if you hadn't helped me. Hm? I made this happen on my own? Because I believed that dreams could come true?
Well, I believed that I'd see you again, my dear, and here we are.

Reunion: Hero of Olympus.Line: Looks like somebody's been working hard! I'd better watch out... ...or pretty soon YOU'LL be everyone's hero!
Herc! Don't say things like that! Are you TRYING to give me a stomachache?
It's true, Phil. I might have some competition.
Then I have two words for ya: Training starts now!
Player, I'd love to catch up, but–

Reunion: For My Sweet Prince.Line: Hello there! Why, I'm making these flowers into crowns for my seven little friends. Oh, this one is for someone special. And don't worry. You'll get one too.

Reunion: Curious Alice.Line: Oh dear! You found me. Well, I've had enough hide-and-seek for one day. Hmm, what shall we do next? Oh, I know! We shall play a trick on that mean old queen and hide something of hers. Yes, her scepter!

No need to worry. Alice has another engagement. All to do with tea and hats and unbirthdays. You mustn't worry. I'll keep an eye on her. Both eyes, in fact. Boredom is such a tricky foe. Perhaps you can defeat it like you defeat the others.

The End of Summer.Line: Sorry to keep you waiting.
Looks like you're having fun.
Hey, guys! Even with all that happened, we had a lot of fun this summer.
My summer vacation is finally over, kupo!
That might be true... ...but I have one last bit of summer fun for all of us.
Bam!
Is that–?
The boss's sea-salt ice cream!
I bought these a few days ago.
So you're the reason they were sold out!
Yep! I didn't think we'd need to wait this long to enjoy them, but...Well, you know what happened.
We sure do, kupo!
It's a perfect way... ...to end the summer!
By the way, how's that homework coming along?
Homework? I thought you said that was just a distraction.
It was, but I also said it was homework. You can have the ice cream...after you complete your task.
Nooo!
Nooo! How...? How...did this happen?
It's because...we wanted to enjoy our summer, kupo. And that meant no working.
The ice cream is starting to melt.
Fine! Come on, let's get this over with. Don't eat my ice cream while I'm gone!
Forget the ice cream and focus on the mission, kupo!
The Desert Oasis
Hey there, friend! It's been a while.
It's very nice to see you again.

You came out here looking for us? Bet that took a while. We're lucky. The Magic Carpet can get us pretty far in no time at all. In fact, we're talking about visiting some neighboring countries. You know, take in the sights, enjoy new experiences, like Genie.
Yes, I can't wait to meet new people. There's so much we can learn.
Would you two cut it out!? But don't you worry, I'll always have time for more adventures.

The Keyblade's Light.Line: The Keyblade holds the power of light— the power to drive away the darkness. Not everyone can wield the Keyblade. You were chosen because of the light in your heart, and now your Keyblade is brimming with that same light. Because of you, your friends are safe and sound. You're doing good, kiddo. Oh, and I have a little something for you. Dun dada duun! We make a great team, you and me.

Until the Time Comes.Line: I see you share a connection with him. You'll find me here when the time comes.

Trapped in the Data World.Line: Why...! Why does the ending... ...never alter!?
Because I knew you would come from the future, Maleficent.
It's clear why you're here, Maleficent. You want to erase your humiliating defeat from history... ...and collect the seven hearts of pure light.

But changing the past is not as easy as you think. There are rules when it comes to time travel. You can only return to a time where a version of you exists. But to do so, you must first separate your heart and body. When that boy pierced your heart with his keyblade... You remembered what you learned from the old Keyblade wielder, didn't you? You thought you could finally use it to traverse time.
But the Master knew you would use that method to come to the past. That's why the Enchanted Dominion was never created... ...in the real world before the Keyblade War.
Enough! Are you saying this is a trap!?

Indeed. You see... Before the Keyblade War, Keyblade wielders defeated monsters and gathered light... ...from the worlds of the future seen in the Book of Prophecies. But after the War... ...the Master and foretellers vanished... ...and the tragic memories of the remaining Keyblade wielders were overwritten. The worlds from the Book of Prophecies became unreachable. But there within the data, the worlds were recreated... ...including worlds unfamiliar to the real world.
Impossible! Are you implying this isn't the real world?
No. This is a world of data. What has been written here cannot be changed.
I see. So you have trapped me here, away from the real world, because you feared my power.

Not quite. It wasn't your power I feared... ...but the act of you taking the knowledge of the past to the future. That's why only six worlds containing hearts of pure light were created here. I didn't want you learning what happens in that seventh world.
How interesting. Now, what do you intend to do with me? Keep me trapped here in this "data" world?
No, that I can't do. You must return to your original time.
But travel into the future is impossible!

Shift Pride.Line: What's going on?
Oh, hey.
What did you want to talk about? I've got books that need reading.
I'll be quick.
Where's Lauriam?
He's not coming.
What?
Then shouldn't we do this some other time?
Hmm. I'd prefer if all five of us were here for this.
Lauriam said you have his support, no matter what.
Huh?
It's simple. He believes in you, Mr. Leader.
But EVERYONE here is a leader.
I guess you've got a point. Well, let's get started for now.
A-all right. When we became Union leaders... ...we all received a copy of the rulebook. Do you remember reading about Shift Pride?
That. Right...
You mean the part about Keyblade wielders fighting each other? Sure. Why do you ask?
Wait. Keyblade wielders fighting each other!?
Didn't you read the book, Ven?
I did, but...I guess I didn't realize what it meant.
Isn't it just a friendly competition? I think everyone could use a bit of entertainment. Besides, it's not like we have much of a choice. It's in the book.
I know, but...
I disagree.
Whoa, Ven. When did you grow a spine?
This is serious. I don't like the thought of wielders turning their weapons against each other.
Not again...Don't get involved. I know it's frustrating, but you can't fix everything. Everyone seems to have a bone to pick. I hope things don't get any worse...
Player! Wait! We're all on the same side!
Are we? Then why did they steal our Lux?
What are you talking about? We're just trying to protect the light. I'll bet good munny that it's your Union that's fallen into darkness. Traitors!
What did you say!? How can you prove YOU'RE not the traitor!?
Hold on! We're all on the same side! Why are you fighting!?
Mind your own business!
Stop it!
Skuld!
Who are you? Which Union do YOU belong to?
It doesn't matter. Our only enemy is darkness. Our Keyblades aren't meant to harm one another!
Anyone who tries to steal the light is no different than a monster of darkness!
What!?
The war's already begun.
I also disagree. Nothing good will come of it.
Well, it's two against one. It's up to you, Ephemer.
Up to me, huh? I think we should do what it says.
What!?
Ephemer!
Lauriam also agrees. So I guess it's settled.
Not so fast, Brain.
What?

I said we should follow the book. But I don't want wielders fighting each other. Remember how all the worlds were recreated as data after the Keyblade War? That means we were also recreated as data. All of us.
...Oh, I get it.
Get what?
People don't have to fight each other. They can fight other wielders' data instead.
That way, we can still follow the rules without actually hurting one another. Right?
Exactly.
I can agree to that!
Yeah, me too.
It's a clever plan and all, but... A little TOO clever coming from you.
Hey! Well, maybe I did have a little help from Lauriam.
Lauriam?
Yeah, a few days ago—
What's the matter? You look troubled.
Oh, hey, Lauriam. I was thinking about that Shift Pride thing mentioned in the book.
Oh, yeah?

It might just be a friendly competition, but I don't like the thought of wielders fighting each other. But it's written in the book, so we have no choice. Why would Master Ava and the others want us to do this?
Hmm. Maybe it's all just a big prank?
Come on, be serious.
But you smiled. You really need to take it easy. Stop being so serious all the time.
You're right. I have been kind of anxious since I became a Union leader. Thanks, Lauriam.
Don't mention it. There are only five of us, and we need to stick together.
Where are you going?

Well, once the Keyblade War ended... ...the worlds were recreated in data along with the people in them. I'm looking for someone who was supposed to have become a Dandelion... ...but I haven't seen them anywhere. So I thought I'd search the data.
That's worrying. Can I help?
Thanks, but it's a personal matter. I'd like to sort it out myself.
He's looking for someone?
I wonder who.
It seems like a private matter, so let's not get involved. Not unless he asks us to.
You're right.
In any case, we can thank Lauriam for this solution. I wouldn't have come up with it myself! Too bad he's not here to take credit for it.

Elrena.Line: I want to ask you about my sister... ...Strelitzia.

\"Someone\".Line: Are you Elrena?
Yes, I am.
I want to ask you about my sister... ...Strelitzia.
Strelitzia's gone missing?

Yes, and she mostly kept to herself so I don't know what happened to her. Yours is the only name I've ever heard her mention. You two were in the same part a few times, right? I was wondering if you knew anything.
I didn't know her very well. She was on her own most of the time. We would chat about missions, but we weren't what you'd call "friends."

I see. She wasn't sure about joining the Dandelions at first, but I managed to convince her. I didn't have many chances to see her after that... ...and then I realized it's been a while since I've seen her at all.
I saw her every now and then, but we didn't talk much. She always seemed to be waiting for someone.
Someone?

She used to sit and wait on a rooftop in Fountain Square. But that was a while ago. Remember when Master Ava gave that speech about Unions fighting one another? Nothing seemed to ever come of it... ...but it was around that time.
(Nothing came of it, huh? These must be the new memories they were given.) (So my sister was around until before the war...) (She couldn't have gotten caught up in it, could she?)
You really care about her, don't you?
You can tell, huh?
I wish there was some way I could help. Oh! Maybe there is. Chirithy!
Here I—
Weren't you friendly with Strelitzia's Chirithy?
Yup!
Did you two ever talk about her?
Hmm. You're a Union leader, aren't you?
This is Strelitzia's older brother, Lauriam. She seems to have gone missing. Is there anything you can remember that might help?
Hmm... When I last saw her, she was searching for someone.
Again, this "someone."
She was really curious about them, but she didn't even know their name.
So they weren't friends?
All I know is that it was someone who didn't talk much, but someone she wanted to invite to become a Dandelion.
Did you last see her before or after the bells?
Bells? Oh, um, I think it was before.
I see. (So she definitely disappeared before the Keyblade War.) (Maybe this "someone" is the key to finding out what happened.)

The last time I saw her was around here. I was talking to her Chirithy, but when people went into this house... ...her Chirithy hurried back to Strelitzia. Shortly after, they announced the new Union leaders, and that's when I recognized one of them: Skuld.
Skuld!?
Does any of this help?
It does. Will you let me know if you think of anything else?
Of course.
Thanks. I'll see you later.
Where are you going?
This is where she was last seen, right? There may be a clue.
Since when do you care about others?
Shush, you!
Hi there.
Good, you're here.
I didn't realize you were going to show up so soon. If I had, I would've waited to talk about Shift Pr—
Skuld, I need to ask you something.
Me?
So that's what happened.
I'm sorry I can't be of any help.
No, it's fine. Thanks anyway. My sister has such a good heart. I wouldn't be surprised if she accidentally got caught in the war trying to save this "someone".
Oh, no...
If I may.
What is it?

We know that until the bells rang, your sister was searching for this "someone"... ...to invite them to join the Dandelions. From this, we can deduce that your sister, who was already a member... ...didn't see them at Fountain Square during Master Ava's speech. And if this person wasn't there that day... ...there's a good chance they fought in the Keyblade War. And another thing. Your sister was hesitant to become a Dandelion, and yet... ...not only did she join them, she wanted desperately for this "someone" to join too. Puzzling, isn't it?
I think...I may know who this person is.
Really?
Someone who's not very talkative, someone who didn't join the Dandelions.
Oh!
You know who it is?
A friend of mine.

Long Time, No See.Line: Long time, no see! I know we haven't had a chance to talk much lately, but I've been swamped. I've heard that you're doing really well with your missions, though!
You must be busy too. Mr. Union Leader.
So what did you want to talk about today?
Someone wants to meet you. You know the Union leaders, right?
I'm Lauriam. It's nice to meet you. I'd like to ask you a few questions. Is that all right?
So you don't know either, huh?
But it did clear up one thing.
Well, I have to excuse myself. There's someplace I need to be.
Do you have to go too?
No, I thought we could spend the day together, if you don't have anything else planned.
Player. It was nice meeting you. This may not make much sense to you, but please... ...keep my sister in your heart, okay? Thank you.

Strelitzia's Whereabouts.Line: No problem. Thanks for your help. I've managed to uncover some things since.
That's wonderful! We actually found something too.
After you left, we took a look inside.
This place gives me the creeps.
Anyone there!? Should we head back?
We came back a few times, but we never saw her again.
Also! I remembered something. Something Strelitzia's Chirithy mentioned the last time we talked.
She doesn't even know their name?
Why does she want to invite them to join the Dandelions?
Well... I can't really say much... ...but she wants to save them from the war that's going to— Huh!? Whaaat? Sorry, I need to go!
Her Chirithy talked about a war? Are you sure?
Master Ava spoke about a war in her speech. But it never happened. That was strange.
(Strelitzia was certain the Keyblade War was going to become a reality.) (But how could she have known?)
Your sister was hesitant to become a Dandelion, and yet... ...not only did she join them, she wanted desperately for this "someone" to join too. Puzzling, isn't it?

The Plan.Line: Oh, sorry. It's just that you haven't put down that book. I was just wondering what you were reading about.
I knew Ephemer was curious. But Brain, you take the cake.
We're still headed for inevitable destruction.

And I'm gonna change that. This world is on a path headed for destruction. Overwriting peoples' memories of the Keyblade War didn't change that. So I came up with a plan. I'm going to become a virus and overwrite the program that is this world's future.

It's Already Begun.Line: I haven't had that much fun in a long time! Thanks,Player ! It's good to take a break every now and then.
I hope we see you again soon!
Skuld. What do you think about Brain's plan?

He's called Brain for a reason. He knows a lot more about this than any of us. I just don't understand why the Dandelions needed to be saved from the Keyblade War if we were doomed from the beginning.
I don't get it either. Should we talk to Ephemer and see what he thinks?
...A great...don't...you think? Oh, and it's...also need...to shape... world into...supposed...be.
What's going on? What is this?
Yes, he was headed to the control room.
Well, I should be heading back.

Entering the Chaos.Line: Have they made their way inside!?

Surrounded.Line: What is this!? Brain! Brain! Where are you?
Hey! You know Player isn't allowed in here.
This is an emergency. Besides, I trust Player. Let's go.
I didn't expect to see you here, Ven.
Well, we were sitting around talking, when suddenly Master Ava appeared... ...or something that looked an awful lot like her. And—
Oh, it's nice to meet you.
Oh, right. And I thought Brain might know something so I came looking for him.

Beyond the Wall.Line: We don't know what's waiting for us in there.
Wait a minute!Player 's not allowed in there!

The Cause of It All.Line: Brain!
Brain!
Ephemer, Ven. And you are?
This is Player, the friend I mentioned before. Brain, what's going on? Some strange things are happening outside.

I've managed to stop the infestation. For now. Let me explain what's going on as simply as I can. Before the Keyblade War, in the world we call Daybreak Town, we were able to visit worlds from the future via the Book of Prophecies. It was like a pop-up book of sorts. It projected the future of worlds— worlds that currently existed. Technically, you didn't have to rely on the Book to get to these worlds, since they were all connected to Daybreak Town by land. You could've visited the present versions of these worlds if you'd wanted to.
We could've gone to all those places?

Well, it wouldn't have been that easy. The world is a big place after all. Now, after the Keyblade War, the worlds all broke apart from each other; they were no longer connected. It was written in the Book that that would happen, so all the worlds had been recreated as data in preparation to ensure that even without the Book, the worlds and their futures would still be accessible through a virtual setting. With me so far?
Yes.

Much like before the war, we Dandelions have continued to visit these worlds by way of the virtual Daybreak Town. From the real Daybreak Town, we make our way to the virtual one, and from there, the world of our choice. Still with me?
I-I think so. Please, keep going.
Question: Is the Daybreak Town we're in right now... ...real or virtual?
Hmm. It would make the most sense for this to be the real world.
Right? But there are things happening here that shouldn't be.
So we're in the virtual world?
I wish it were that clear. Like Ephemer said, this should be the real world... ...and yet those glitches are obviously a phenomenon that belongs to the virtual one.
Then what's going on?

Remember at the beginning I explained that this world is like a portal connecting to the future of worlds that already exist? That was the case until now. Somehow, it's connected to a place that doesn't exist in this world or time.
What? How!?
Your guess is as good as mine. I don't know if this is all part of the plan or what. All I know is that we know practically nothing about this new location.
I see.

I also know that the glitches started appearing once we connected to this place. It's impossible to completely sever the connection, but I did manage to stabilize it. We'll have to poke around to get some answers.
You want us to go there?
It's the best way to find out what's going on.
All right. I'm in.
What!?
I thought you might say that, and while I appreciate the gesture, the leader should stay in case something happens. I think we should send a Dandelion. After all, it's just like any other mission.
But it's too dangerous!
But it's too dangerous!
What do you think?
I'll go.
Player!
What!?
It'll be fine. All you need to do is secure the route, and I should be able to stabilize it so we can come and go as we please from this end. That way, the others will be able to join you later.
I should go too. But Player ...
Fine. Better two heads than one anyway. Friendship's a beautiful thing. Just remember: come back immediately if you sense any danger. It's still unstable. Hurry.

A New Portal.Line: This sure doesn't look like the others.
Maybe we're already there. Ack! Where's they come from!?
We need to get past them!

A World Connected.Line: Let's chase after it! This must be it.

Let's Split Up.Line: Is this...the world we were looking for?
I think so. I wonder where all those entrances lead. Look! Over there!
