We need to find out what's causing the glitches, and why the Darklings are here. Let's split up. I'll take the Darklings. Player, can I count on you to investigate the glitches?

A Worthy Investigation.Line: Drat, we lost them. We need to find them and stop whatever they're planning to do in this world! There are Heartless here too!? I guess you know what to do.

The Large Man.Line: Wait– who are you? Oh, I get it. You're going Turbo! Well, not in my game!

Ralph's Dream.Line: Ralph? Ralph! No! He couldn't be, could he...? Oh no! Just what do you think you're doing? You can't come into your game and do that. Yes, Ralph IS the Bad Guy, but we need him. He wrecks the building, and I fix it. I'm supposed to defeat him. Me– Felix! The player didn't notice anything, but be careful! If they think our game is broken, we'll get unplugged. Well, I've got to get ready for the party, friend. So long!
The Nicelanders never invite me to their parties. I know I'm a Bad Guy, but I'm not actually a "bad" guy.

A Link with Darkness.Line: Hmm, no sight of any glitches. But we can't leave them here to cause trouble. Hey. Remember that man from before? Ralph? We should talk to him. Maybe he knows something. After all, there is a sort of link between bad guys and darkness.

The Penthouse.Line: Ooh, fireworks! How pretty! Wait, what are we doing? We need to find Ralph! There he is! Wait, you knew where he was this whole time? Why didn't you say anything sooner? And what are you waiting for?

Proof of a Good Guy.Line: I don't think it's a coincidence that you ran into Heartless while you were chasing Ralph. He must be connected to the darkness somehow.
Now you're just being ridiculous. Only Good Guys win medals, and you, sir, are no Good Guy.
I could be a Good Guy if I wanted to, and I could win a medal!
Uh-huh. And when you do, come and talk to us. But it will never happen because you're just the Bad Guy who wrecks the building.
You know what? I'm gonna win a medal. Oh, I am gonna win a medal! The shiniest medal this place has ever seen!

Oh, hello there. Are you here for the party? It's the 30th anniversary party for our game, Fix-It Felix, Jr. At least, it was until Ralph showed up and ruined everything, including the cake. Well, I better get in there and fix things up. Poor Ralph. He wants to get a medal and prove he's a Good Guy. But I don't know how since they don't give medals to Bad Guys.
The Heartless are gone, but I'm worried about Ralph. Let's stay a while longer and see if we can find out what's going on.

Missing.Line: Say, friend, have  you seen Ralph? He's missing and our game won't work without him. Wait, are they friends of yours? Well, I'm afraid you'll all have to go. If the players notice any non-Fix-It Felix, Jr. characters in here, there will be trouble. Er, what I meant is, we already have our own Bad Guy. But thanks for visiting!

Out of Order.Line: Oh, no! We're out of order! I have to fix this. In the meantime, I will thank you to keep your shenanigans out of our game! Oh, where is Ralph? What a terrible way to start our 31st year. He's probably just getting a root beer at his favorite hangout. If you're headed there, can you give him a message? Tell him to come back here quick.

To the Unknown.Line: Do you have a plan? Because I don't. How are we going to find Ralph? We don't know his favorite hangout, and it'll take forever if we have to search every– Or not! Over there! He's dressed differently, but that's definitely Ralph. Let's follow him!

A Different World.Line: Quarter alert. Quarter alert. This is not a drill.
This doesn't look anything like where we were before.  It's like a whole other world. I don't see Ralph anywhere, but the path leads that way. Let's follow it. Heartless!

Pep Talk.Line: Now listen up! I'm only gonna say this once. It's make-your-mamas-proud time!
Ralph MUST be connected to darkness somehow. Don't worry. We've been through this before. You know what to do.

Ready, Rookie?.Line: We are humanity's last hope. Our mission? Destroy all cy-bugs. You ready, rookie? Let's find out.
They're not Heartless, but they sure don't like us either!

On the Battlefield.Line: Don't let your guard down! A civilian?

Game Over.Line: What's the first rule of Hero's Duty, soldier? Never interfere with the first-person shooter! Our job is to get the gamers to the top of that building so they can get a medal. And that's it. So stick to the program, soldier!
All right, pussy willows, back to start positions!
So that's where they keep the medal, huh?

The Tower.Line: Huh? Where'd they go? That's where Ralph was headed. I wonder what's in there. Let's find out!

High Definition.Line: I'm Fix-It Felix, Jr., ma'am, from the game Fix-It Felix, Jr. Jiminey-jaminey! Look at that high definition. Your face! It's amazing!
Flattery don't charge these batteries, civilian. Now state your business.
Oh, I'm looking for my colleague, Wreck-It Ralph.

Fused Together.Line: You said that before, but what do you mean?
Did they...fuse together? This isn't good! It looks like that monster somehow absorbed the Darkling into itself. We need to defeat it before it's too late. Are you ready?

Common Enemy.Line: This isn't like any cy-bug I've seen before! You're that civilian who ran past me before. And you. You look like you can handle yourself. Hope you're ready to prove it.
No problem! This is just like our missions back home.
That's what I like to hear. Now, listen up! Our mission is to destroy that abomination!

Ralph and a Cy-Bug.Line: And that's how it's done. As for the rest, once the beacon's up, they'll be cy-bug splatter in no time. More importantly, we've got a cy-bug and soldier that are MIA.
That wasn't a soldier, ma'am. That was Ralph! He disappeared with that...that monster.

Sorting Out the Facts.Line: I see. So you think there might be a link between the bad guy, Ralph, and the glitches. Player, can you keep looking into the glitches? I'll head back and inform the others about the Darklings. I'm tasking you with this because I trust you. And I know you'll be fine on your own. Besides, even when we're apart, our hearts are always connected. Don't forget that.

Cornerstones of the New World.Line: I was a young boy when—
Huh!?
What? Even I was a kid once.
Right. Of course.
... Anyway, I was a young boy when the Keyblade War began.
What!? There was a Keyblade War back then too?
Yep, that's right.
Did you have a Master of your own?
Nope.
Who was fighting who?
Who do you think? Light and darkness.
Light? There were wielders besides you?
Hmm... There were, but they don't really count.
And the darkness? Were there monsters like there are now?
Okay, no more questions until I finish my story.
Right, sorry.
To answer your question, if I had to call them something, "monsters" would be pretty accurate. But they looked like us .
Oh, so they were human?
I didn't say that. Anyway, the Keyblade War dates back to when darkness took that form... ...and it's still waging as we speak.
What? It's still going on?
Yes, the battle with darkness never stopped. The Keyblade War isn't about to begin. In fact, it might finally come to an end.

Darkness is constantly changing shape. It can even hide among humans. That's the reason the war was never able to end. The coming battle will end the world. Everything will be destroyed. The wielders sent outside will gather light from the now scattered worlds... ...and with that light, the world will be rebuilt.
The world will end and be rebuilt...?

That's right. You can't erase what lives on in the hearts of children—worlds and their stories, and most of all, light. Of course, you can't erase the darkness, either. But you can call a truce. I could go for a nice, long break right about now! Maybe I'll kick back for a while.
What? You're going to sit back... ...and leave the fate of the world in other people's hands?

Why not? That's why I'm having Ava round up the best of the best. They'll start at χ, become unchained, and fulfill their duty through Union Cross. Those wielders will be the cornerstones of the new world.
Cornerstones...? But they can come home once they're done, right?
Well... Maybe not all of them.

Trapped in a Data Cage.Line: How's it going?
Perfect timing! Ephemer just got back. And I was about to ask Ven to go get you two.
Skuld filled me in on the situation. Did you figure out what was causing the glitches?

Sort of.  You see, before the Keyblade War... ...Daybreak Town was recreated as data along with all the other worlds. That's why even though the worlds were destroyed, they're still connected to Daybreak Town... ...and we're still able to visit them— or at least their data copies.
It's precisely because they're data that a connection from the real world is possible. But now... ...a new world has aggressively forged a connection with this one.
My friend and I followed the Darklings there and did some investigating. It looks like that's where the creatures that have been popping up in our world have been coming from.
Do you think the Darklings guided them here?
Most likely, but I can't imagine why.
You know, we saw a glitch that looked like Master Ava here in the tower.
These glitches... They're showing up in town too. I saw one of Strelitzia.
Your sister?
Yeah. I came here because I thought you might be able to make some sense of it.

Hmm... According to Ephemer, the residents of the newly connected world are aware that they live in a data world. That got me thinking... We know the monsters from the new world can infiltrate our world... ...Ven and Skuld saw a glitch of Master Ava, and Lauriam of his sister. We were so sure we were in the real Daybreak Town... ...but all signs point to this being a data world too.
The real Daybreak Town still exists, right?
What? Please say Daybreak Town hasn't disappeared!
We have no way of knowing right now. I'm fairly confident we were in the real world until this all broke out, at least.
So we can't get back? We're stuck here?
We thought we had gone back, but it turns out we didn't... ...which means we can't go back to the usual way. But if you give me a bit more time, I might be able to figure something out.
Why is this happening?

If I had to guess, there's someone behind all this. That's the only thing that makes sense. I don't know why... ...but this data world was probably made to be cut off from the real world from the start. There might not even be a reason for it, aside from being a means to some other end.
We escaped the war, only to find ourselves trapped in a cage? Irony at its best.
It couldn't have been Master Ava. She gathered us together so she could keep light alive. She wouldn't trick us like this.

At this point, we can't be sure of anything. We don't know if Master Ava knew about any of this... ...or who's responsible for the program. In any case, like I said before... ...I'm going to become a virus and overwrite it.
Where are you going?
Downstairs.
Do you have a plan?
Not yet. I wonder if there's anything written about this...

The Book.Line: Me? A Union leader? You've got to be joking.
I'm serious.
I'm not cut out for leadership. What exactly factored into that decision?
The Master's orders.
Your Master? The Master of Masters?
Yes. And I'm sure you'll do fine.
You say that like it's going to be easy. It sounds like a lot of work. And who are the other four, anyway?
I can't tell you that yet.

I get it. The five of us are supposed to convene after the war... ...so you can't have us meeting up and doing something unexpected before then, right? It kinda sounds like you're asking us to be pawns in someone else's game.
Clever as always, Brain.
Thanks, but I'm not sure I'm interested.
What if I told you the fate of this world was already decided?
That'd be terrible.
Why?
If everything's already been decided for you, where's the fun in that?
What if that wasn't decided for you... ...but you knew what would happen next?
Is this about the Book of Prophecies?
Yes. If you knew what the future held, wouldn't you know how to change it?
That's true... Wait. But if you do change something... ...isn't THAT what would be written in the Book? Hmm... How would that work? Does the Book get overwritten every time something changes?
We don't know what happens. Maybe... ...it leads to a completely new and undecided future.
Is that what this is about?
No, it's just something I've been thinking about. About what would happen if we altered our fate. This is for you. I was tasked to give this Book to one of you.
What? Me?

The Master also gave me this list with the names of the five Union leaders. The one whose name is circled gets the Book. No one else should read it under any circumstances. I put it between the pages on which your fates are written. Brain, I trust you'll understand my message when the time comes.
Don't worry, I already got your message loud and clear.
Any ideas?
Are you kidding? It's only been a few minutes.
True. The others decided to stay in the control room a bit longer.
All right.

I know it's not the best time for this, but I spoke with a friend of Strelitzia's. Apparently, before she disappeared, she talked about the Keyblade War... ...as if she was sure it was coming. You mentioned before that you couldn't figure out why Strelitzia wanted someone to join the Dandelions... ...when she'd been so hesitant to join herself. I think it's because she knew the Keyblade War was about to become a reality.
But all of the Dandelions knew about the war. They'd known for a while, even a latecomer like her.
Right. She knew about it the whole time, so why would she suddenly try to getPlayer  to join?
I see what you're getting at. Something made her absolutely sure the war WAS gonna happen.
I think so.
I won't open the Book if I can avoid it.
That's fine. You'll know when it's time.
I might have an idea.
What is it?
Can you give me some time alone to think?
Sure. Let me know if you need any help.
Will do.

Darkness in the Land of Light.Line: So this is Daybreak Town... Such a perfectly foul place that reeks of light. You say this world holds the key to returning to my own time?

A Sweet Encounter.Line: So I asked around... ...and it sounds like Ralph flew that pod thing into another game!
Sugar Rush...Cy-bugs will chew up that game faster than a chicken hawk in a coop full of crippled roosters.
What're you, thick? There was a cy-bug on that shuttle! Do you even know what a cy-bug is?
I can't say that I do, ma'am.

Cy-bugs are like a virus. They don't know they're in a game. ALl they know is eat, kill, multiply. Without a beacon to stop them, they'll consume Sugar Rush and invade every other game... ...until this arcade is nothing but a smoking husk of forgotten dreams.
Wait, ma'am! I'm going with you!
Like fun you are, shortstack. You die outside your game, and you don't regenerate.
Well, neither do you, ma'am. And it is my job to fix what Ralph wrecks. And I cannot ask you to risk your life cleaning up his mess. No flex on this one, ma'am. I am coming along with you.
Not you, civilian. This mission is strictly key personnel only.

And there they go. Those cy-bugs pose a threat to the world, just like the Heartless. Maybe they're a kind of darkness too. But let's worry about that later. For now, we need to find Ralph since he might be causing our world's glitches. This looks familiar. This is what Ralph flew off in, isn't it? Well, he can't have gone far. Let's find him!

Ticket to a Better Life.Line: That's MY medal! It's precious to me. That thing is my ticket to a better life.
Yeah, well, now it's my ticket.
Come back! I'll find you! I will find you!

Vanellope.Line: I finally got the gold coin I need, and now this is happening!? What's goin' on!? Somebody, help! Phew! That's better. Whoa. Who are you? And how are you doing this!? Oh, I'm Vanellope. Nice to meet ya! If you can't tell, I'm a natural-born racer, and today's race is gonna start any second! Come on, it's this way, straight through the forest!

The Empty Racetrack.Line: Huh? What happened to the race?
Well, thank goodness! What were they, anyway? Dark creatures barging into my kingdom uninvited...
Vanellope! I knew it! This is all  your fault!
What are you talking about? I didn't do anything! ...Wait! What happened to the race?
Hey! You ruined my chance to finally race! Actually, maybe he was right. The race can wait. I'm outta here!

I'm in the Race!.Line: You! Give me back my medal right now!
Good, you're here! Gotta go! Yes! I'm finally in the race!

King Candy's Request.Line: You have my gratitude. What were those monsters anyway? Heartless? I see. And I can't forget about this thing– For a moment, I thought it would destroy everything. But thanks to you, the damage can be easily repaired. We will have our race as planned. Thank you. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have an interrogation to get to. Sour Bill, that glitch cannot be allowed to race. Find her!
Okay, but where? Um, they appeared together. He/she might know something.

Well, why didn't you say so!? You there. Are you friends with the glitch, Vanellope? You just met? Well, as  you can see, she's quite the little troublemaker. We were looking for her just to make sure she's safe. But alas, it's almost time for the race...Would you be so kind as to retrieve her for me? Good. I knew I could count on you.
Are you sure about this? A character from a different game?
Who cares? I'll use anything or anyone to keep her from racing.
Always helping out someone in need. Just remember, your goal is to find Ralph and uncover if he's the one causing glitches in our world. Now that I think about it, did that monster remind you of him?

I Knew It.Line: Yeah, but you're always nearby, right?
I know it's been a while, but I have a favor to ask.
Seriously? You could at least try to butter me up before asking me for something. Unbelievable...

A Way to the Future.Line: There's not a soul to be seen. So this is also inside the "data"?
Yes. Head for that tower up ahead.
And I can return to my time from there?
Not directly. From the tower, you can get back to the real world and find the lifeboat that's hidden in the real tower
It was intended to be a way to escape from our world. It was never finished though, so it's still incomplete.
Incomplete? Of what use is it to me in such a state?

It's useful to you BECAUSE it's incomplete. You need to escape this TIME, not this world. In its incomplete state, the lifeboat can't sustain a passenger's body at the speed it moves. Which means if you board it, your body will be lost, leaving only your heart to be transported. Without your body slowing you down, you'll be able to break the time barrier at the speed of light.
Only my heart? What do you propose I do without a body? I'll be no better than a ghost when I arrive.
All you need is a medium to form your body, and someone with memories of you. As long as those exist in the future when you arrive... ...your heart will grow a new body to inhabit on its own.
Mere talk won't persuade me. I need something more substantial. Can you prove that there will be a body for me in the future?
I can. According to the Book of Prophecies, you exist in the future.
!? You know what's written in the Book of Prophecies?

A Replacement.Line: I'm surprised you asked me to come all the way out here.
There's something I wanted to discuss with you privately.
The surprises keep coming!
This is where Master Ava told me I'd been chosen to become a Union leader.
Really? She brought me here too.
Master Ava was an odd one out among the Masters. She was so...
Easy to talk to!
Yeah, she was. Ephemer, there's something important I need to tell you.
What is it?
One of the new Union leaders was chosen to receive a copy of the Book of Prophecies.
The Book of Prophecies?
Yeah. It was to make sure that even without the Masters' guidance, we would be able to recreate the worlds and keep gathering light.
But weren't the other worlds already recreated as data?
Yes, so this is a kind of insurance. Think of it like a back-up in case there was a problem with the data. Although, I have yet to actually use it.
What? Brain, you have the Book of Prophecies? !
More importantly, look at this note. The names of the five chosen Union leaders are here... ...with the recipient of the Book of Prophecies marked.
This is...

That's right. I'm not the one who was supposed to get the Book. But that's not the only thing that's off. One of the other leaders has been replaced entirely. Lauriam's sister, Strelitzia, was originally meant to become a Union leader.
That's...
And the one who decided to give the Book of Prophecies to me... ...was Master Ava.
But why?

By changing who gets the Book... ...she was betting on the possibility that the future it contained could be rewritten. It was Master Ava's one act of resistance against fate. At least, that's how I see it. But I don't think the replacement Union leader was a part of Master Ava's plan.
Yeah...
So that's why I'd like to have a little chat. With the replacement.

Snow in the Replacement.Line: Yeah, it looks like it might even snow.
I'm not good with the cold.
Really? I kind of like it.
Wow, it even snows in the data world!
Looks like it... Do you think it's snowing in the real Daybreak Town, too?
Maybe... By the way, where are the others?
I think Brain is looking for a way back to our world, probably with Ephemer. And I'd guess Lauriam is off in search of clues about his sister.
Right... So what should WE do?
How about we make a snowman?
Yeah! It's been a while since we've let loose and had some fun.
Think the others are enjoying the snow too?
Aha, I finally found you! I searched the whole tower for you!
Could you come with me for a bit?

A Broken Kart.Line: Hey, it's you! Thanks for helping me out back there.
I got to get my medal back. It's that little crumb snatcher. And her friend who keeps gettin' in the way.

Well, how does it look? Built it myself. Fastest pedal power west of the pinball machine. Check her out. No way! I'm not going with you! I'm in the race! I paid the entry fee, and I'm on the roster. I'm gonna be in that race! Stop! No!

To the Kart Bakery.Line: You're welcome, you rotten little thief.
I'm not a thief! I just borrowed your stupid coin. I was gonna give it back to you as soon as I won the race.
It's not a coin. It is a medal.
Coin, medal, whatever. Just go back to your own dumb game and win another one.
I can't. I didn't win it in my game. I won it in Hero's Duty. I earned that medal, and you better get it back for me toot-sweet, sister!

Well, unless you've got a go-kart hidden in the fat folds of  your neck, I can't help you! Look, you want that medal, right? And I wanna race. So here's what I'm thinking. You help me get a new kart– a real kart –and I'll win the race and get back your medal.
You want me to help you?
Yeah. I already have one volunteer, but I could really use another one. Come on, what do you say, friend?
Ah, come on, pal. Come on, buddy. Let's shake on it. Come on, chumbo. Ralph, my man– my main man. Hey! My arm's getting tired. We have a deal or not?
Yes! Next stop– the kart bakery!

The Plot Thickens.Line: I'm back!
Great.
Hey, guys. What's up?
You brought them both?
I didn't have much of a choice, you know.
Hey, did you see? It was snowing!
But you didn't call us out here to talk about the weather, did you?
You're right, I didn't. There's something I want to ask you. Who told you that you were chosen to be a Union leader?
Master Ava.
Yeah, same here.
Brain, maybe we should talk to them separately.
Huh?
What?
Where were you when she told you?
We were right here.
For me, it was... ...near the clock tower.
...Interesting.
What is this? Some kind of interrogation?
It's not like that, Skuld.
Are we being suspected of something?
Ventus, Skuld, let me explain. You see, Master Ava entrusted me with something.
Is that the Book of Prophecies!?
That's right. And inside it... ... Master Ava tucked away a note listing the names of the five new Union leaders. The name of the one originally meant to receive the Book is circled.
Originally? It wasn't you?

Nope. I guessed as much when she gave me this. Master Ava wanted to defy fate and change the future, so she gave it to me instead. But something else is off... The list of Union leaders itself. One of the names doesn't match up. Lauriam's sister, Strelitzia, was supposed to be a Union leader.
What? So Master Ava swapped out one of the leaders too?

I don't think so. If Master Ava had planned to switch out a Union leader... ...she wouldn't have given me this note in the first place. As for Strelitzia... ...it might be easy to suspect Master Ava may be involved with her disappearance... ...but I don't believe she is. She's not that kind of person.
Maybe a replacement was chosen after Strelitzia went missing.

That doesn't add up either. Strelitzia was last seen just before the start of the Keyblade War... ...desperately trying to getPlayer  to join the Dandelions. We can assume this is because she heard from Master Ava that she was chosen to be a Union leader and that the war was coming. If Master Ava wanted to switch her out for someone else, even on such short notice, she would have told someone. It would make sense to tell me at least... ...seeing as she trusted me with both the Book and the list of names that was about to change.
That makes sense... Is Lauriam's name on there?
Yeah, it is. We'll discuss this with him later after we know more. He has a lot on his plate right now looking into Strelitzia's disappearance.

We asked you those questions earlier... ...to determine whether or not the replacement knew about any of this. Ephemer and I agreed that even though we know the truth, we don't want anything to change between us.
That's right. And I think we got the answer we were looking for. Like Brain said, nothing changes—we're still a team. We'll keep working together to try to figure this whole thing out.
Ventus. Your name isn't on the list.

A Waypoint.Line: The defenses here are rather lacking.
This place is off-limits, so no one comes in here.
You're certainly knowledgeable about all this— this world, the lifeboat, the lack of defenses. Just who are you?
Think of me as an old friend.
And why would this old friend want so badly to see me back in my own time?
I need you to act as a waypoint.

Didn't I tell you earlier? In order to travel through time, you need a medium to form a body, and someone with memories of you. No one from this world has those in the future. But if we send you back, that all changes. Someone from this time could find their way to you.
That's not important. Getting back to your own time is all that matters, right?
How do we get in? I see. Is this it?
Yes.  If you want to go now, this is your chance.
I wouldn't waste my time snooping around if I were you.
What are YOU doing here? You may want to think carefully before you answer.

Baking a Kart.Line: Welcome to the bakery! Let's bake a kart!
You have one minute to win it. Go! Mixing! Put the ingredients in the  bowl and throw away the trash.
You're getting all the wrong stuff, kid!
Wait! I need your help with this. Hey, take care of 'em, will ya?

A Real Kart.Line: Congratulations! You did it. And here's your kart!
I love it! I love it! I love it! Look, it's got a real engine! And look at these wheels! Oh, I love it! I finally have a real kart!
Start the kart! Start the kart!
What are you waiting for? Come on! Let's go!
I...uh...don't know how to drive a real kart.

A Secret Entrance.Line: Drive into the wall! Right there, between the two sugar-free lollipops!
Just do it! They're right behind us! Hurry!

The Glitch.Line: Where'd they go? Find that glitch! Destroy that kart! She can't be allowed to race!

Why doesn't he want Vanellope in the race? And how was he able to command those Heartless? It looks like Ralph isn't the only one we'll need to investigate. Let's stick with Ralph for now and see if we can get any answers.
What're these? "Diet cola hot springs. Watch out for falling candy"?
Yeah, check it out. Look! Oh, you gotta watch out for the splash. That stuff is broiling hot.
Yeah, I got that, thank you. What is this dump?
I think it's some sort of unfinished bonus level. Yeah, it's pretty cool, huh? I found that secret opening, and now I live here.
Well, yeah. I mean, everyone here says I'm just a mistake, and that I wasn't even supposed to exist. What do you expect?
Listen, kid, I know it's none of my business... ...but why do you even stick around this game?
You really don't know anything, do you? Glitches can't leave their games. It's one of the joys of being me. Hey! What are you doing!? No way! Get out! This is my home!
Stay back. I got this! You ready?

Racing Practice.Line: If you're gonna be a racer, you're gonna have to learn how to drive... ...and you can't do that without a track.
All right now, let's hustle up. We've got some driving to do.
It looks like he's got things under control for now. Let's come back later to see how they're doing.

Master Ava's Plan.Line: But... Master Ava really did tell me I was a Union leader... It's true.
So it was a part of Master Ava's plan, then?

No. Unfortunately, Strelitzia is gone... ...and that's proof enough that it wasn't Master Ava's idea. If it was, she would have taken great care to make sure Strelitzia was safe, not sent her off to war without telling her what was happening. And Master Ava's definitely not the type of person to make someone disappear.
Then who did Ven talk to?
Let's think it through. Why were we chosen as Dandelions?
And what else might want to come along for the ride?
Darkness can hide anywhere. Even inside someone.

The Way Out.Line: What a surprise. So you're all trapped here as well.
I don't recall you being invited.
Then I'd best be on my way.
Hah! You have no idea what this room is, do you?
Nope, and I can't say I'm interested.
Every cage has a door, even this cage of "data." This is that door, and I'll be taking my leave through it. Seeing as I'm not welcome here.
Huh, I didn't know this place was so important. I figured it was just a lab or a storeroom.
You were correct. It seems a great deal of research was once conducted here, and what remains of it was left to gather dust. Now if you don't mind, I'll be on my way.

At the Abandoned House.Line: Darkness disguised itself as Master Ava?
Ventus. Did you notice anything strange when you met with Master Ava?
What did she say to you?

She said she wanted me to become one of the new Union leaders... Then she gave me a rulebook... And told me I should go to the battle-ground when everything was over, and the others would be waiting there.
I recall you saying that when we first met. Anything else?
I remember... ...she told me to come to this old abandoned house.
Wait. Didn't you say you met at the tower?
We met at the house first. Then walked to the tower while we talked.
Can you tell us more about what happened?

Okay...That day, I went to the abandoned house like Master Ava said... Master Ava? It's me, Ventus. Master Ava! Maybe this is the wrong place... ! Who's there? I think... ...that's when Master Ava showed up, and we left the house together. On the way to the tower, she told me I was one of the new Union leaders.
You "think" that's when she came? You're not sure?
I can't remember what happened before we left the house. But... I think we left as soon as she got there.
The person who came to the house, was it really Master Ava?
Let's head back to the tower.

Practice Continues.Line: Sounds like they're still at it. Let's hang back here and take a look around. We don't want to get in their way.

Vanellope May Know.Line: What's up? Yeah. I'm starting to think Ralph just plays the part of a bad guy, too. He's not a BAD guy. That much is obvious from his actions. Which means...We still have no idea where the glitches are coming from. But I'm certain that Heartless has something to do with it. Hmmm...What is it? That's it! You're right. We shouldn't jump to conclusions, or we might miss something important. Again. Let's go talk to Vanellope!

A Visit to the Castle.Line: Oh, I'm Fix-it Felix, Jr., sir, from the game Fix-it Felix, Jr. Have you seen my friend, Ralph?
Should've locked him up when we had the chance.
Not making the same mistake with you.

Lauriam and Strelitzia.Line: Lauriam. Lauriam. I knew you'd be here. Taking a break?
Actually, I'm done collecting my Lux for the day.
But it's only noon.
I know, but I finished a while ago. Taking down monsters is easy. What's that look for?
Oh, I didn't realize I was— It's just— I-I don't know how you do it! You're so amazing!
Thanks.
Me, on the other hand, I spent the whole day getting chased around by them...
You know your magic is stronger than mine. Stay calm and focused, and you'll be done in no time.
I know, but it's hard. Can't we pair up? You take the front, I'll take the back?
We could, but that won't help you in the long run. Maybe when you get strong enough to protect me. Then we'll pair up, and you can carry me through battle.
That sounds impossible...
Oh, I've been meaning to ask: Have you decided to join the Dandelions?
I'm not sure yet.
What's holding you back?
Well, I like the people I'm with now. Besides—
Yeah?
There's someone I wanna get to know. And if they're not a Dandelion, I might never get the chance.
Does someone have a crush?
No, no, no, no! It's nothing like that!
Stay calm, focus, be brave.
Stop it, Lauriam! It's not like that, I swear!
Okay, okay. You make everyone's lives so much brighter. People need that; they need your power. Believe in yourself.
Well, I-I don't know about that... Wait, you're not just saying that, are you?
Not at all. In fact, you just worked that power of yours on me. Things were feeling dull, but now I'm looking forward to what's in store for tomorrow.
Then let's pair—
Nope. But I will come running if you're ever in trouble.
No.
Huh?
You told me what I need to do, so that's what I'll do. I WILL get stronger. I WILL carry you one day.
I like the sound of that. What!? Strelitzia! Strelitzia!
Lauriam.
Strelitzia...?
Lauriam, I...
Strelitzia... I was—I was fighting, and...She's gone... Strelitzia... I...

A Difficult Decision.Line: I'm counting on you to talk a little sense into her.
Can you believe this!? Ralph's trying to get me to drop out of the race! Wait a minute...Where did you get this?
Look, I'm gonna be straight with you, kid. I've been talking to King Candy.
King Candy? You sold me out?
No. I'm not a traitor. Listen.
You're a rat! And I don't need you! I can win the race on my own.
But I'm trying to save your skin, kid!
Hey! Put me down! Let me go!
No, you listen to me. King Candy explained something to me...When the players see you glitching, they're gonna think the game's broken.
I don't care! You're a liar!
Well, you better care, because if your game goes out of order, you go down with the ship, little sister!
I'm not listening to you! Get out of my way! I'm going to that race!
Take me down from here, Ralph, right now!
No. I'm doing this for your own good!
Wait, wait, wait. No, no, no! Please, Ralph! No! Stop it! You really are a bad guy.

I can hardly believe it...Ralph said something back there about Vanellope glitching. Maybe he knows what's causing it. Yeah, I know. I'm worried about Vanellope, too. But if we find out what's causing these glitches, we can help her out at the same time. Trust me on this. Thanks. All right, let's follow Ralph!

\"My Hero\".Line: Everybody's gone. They all left...I didn't mean to cause a problem. I was just tired of living alone in the garbage. I...I thought winning a medal would change everything. Hey! Help me out, will ya?

Talk!.Line: Hey, cough drop. Explain something to me. If Vanellope was never meant to exist... ...then why is her picture on the side of the game console? Wait! Let's get him!

King Candy's Agenda.Line: What's going on in this candy-coated nightmare?
No! Okay, I'll talk! I'll talk! Vanellope WAS a racer until King Candy tried to delete her code...
So that's why she's a glitch! Why is he doing this to her?

I don't know. I swear, I don't know! He literally locked up our memories, and I can't remember. Nobody can. But I do know this– he'll do anything to keep her from racing. Because if she crosses the finish line... ...the game will reset and she won't be a glitch anymore.
In the fungeon with Fix-it Felix.
Felix? How do we get to the fungeon?
There's a trapdoor at the castle entrance. Please, that's all I know. I swear, that's all I know!
Yes, okay, I will. I will. Thanks!
Looks like there was a bad guy bringing darkness to this world after all... ...and that's Kind Candy. It took us a while to figure it out, but you know what we need to do now, right?

Success!.Line: We made it! But I...I can't face Vanellope till I get her kart fixed. Let's find Felix first.

Happy Reunion.Line: Ralph! I'm so glad to see you! Wait. No, I'm not. What do you have to say for yourself!?
Wait! I don't want to hear it. I'm not talking to you!
Okay, don't talk. That's fine. But you have to fix this go-kart for me, pronto.

I don't have to do boo! Forgive my potty mouth. I'm just so cross with you. Do you have any idea what you've put me through? I ran higgledy-piggledy all over creation looking for you. I almost drowned in chocolate milk mix! And then I met the most dynamite gal. Oh, she just gives me the honey-glow something awful. But she rebuffed my affections. And then I got thrown in jail!
No! Ralph, you don't know what it's like to be rejected and treated like a criminal!

Yes, I do. That's every day of my life..Line: Which is why I ran off, and I tried to be a good guy. But I'm not! I'm just a bad guy, and I need your help. There's a little girl whose only hope is this kart. Please, Felix. Fix it, and I promise I will never try to be good again.

Friends Once Again.Line: I know, I know, I know. I'm an idiot.
Yeah, it's race time. You ready?

The Escape.Line: It's the real world. Congratulations on your successful escape.
I have returned to my own time?
No, this is still the past. You just made it back to the real world from the data world.
My patience wears thin. Tell me how to return to where and when I came from!
What!? Then why have you brought me here?
We had to leave the data world... ...before we could even try to travel through time.
Why not do both at once?
Unfortunately, it doesn't work like that. The lifeboat was only made to travel to other worlds, so we're already pushing it to its limits.
Hmph! No matter. So long as I finally reach my destination this time.
And will you be joining me? You should be able to, seeing as you have no physical form to hinder you.
I'll stay here. You'll be fine on your own, and I have some unfinished business to take care of.

The Work of Darkness.Line: He's fast asleep in his room. He seemed pretty exhausted.
He had his head in his hands the whole time. The memories that came back must've been a real shock. None of this is his fault, right? Can you tell us what's going on?
Well, we still don't know all the facts. But going by Ven's story, we know he was there during Strelitzia's final moments. As for who's behind this whole thing...
Yes. Darkness could be much closer than we thought, working right under our noses.

To Defeat Darkness.Line: Hmmm... Hmmm... HMMM
What? What is it? What's the problem?
We can't get rid of the darkness in this world, so we're ending it to escape into another one. We can't win against the darkness, can we?
You don't sound too happy about that.
Of course not! As Keyblade wielders, we're supposed to fight against the darkness. But we're just giving up and running away!
It sounds bad when you put it like that.
There's no other way to put it. And we're gonna have to keep running wherever we go.
Oh, Luxu. I took you under my wing and taught you everything you know. Which is apparently nothing.
What's that supposed to mean?

You think too much. You think and think until you come to some convoluted conclusion, then you get all worked up thinking that must be the answer. And if you don't understand something, you get all worked up concluding that there is no answer. But the answer will come in time.
So I should just wait and see what happens?
As long as you keep moving forward, you'll wind up somewhere.
Hmmm...
What is it now?
Well... I don't like the idea of waiting around for something to happen.
So you want to go through life knowing what's coming?
That's not—
There's a way to win against the darkness.
Huh!?

But it isn't easy. It takes time and careful planning. So much that you couldn't do it in one lifetime, or even two. That's why we need to leave this world— to bring it to an end, to abandon the notion of time and what separates our worlds. All so we can defeat the darkness.

Breath of Darkness.Line: He/she has to be here. This is the only place we haven't checked.
Maybe my eyes were playing tricks on me.
Well, it was worth a shot. I'll head back to Fountain Square.

Let the Race Begin!.Line: My sweet subjects! I can, without a pinch of hesitation, assure you... ...that I have never been so happy in all my life to say the following words. Let the Random Roster Race commence!
Remember, you don't have to win. Just cross that finish line, and you'll be a real racer.
I'm already a real racer. And I'm gonna win.
Okay, kid. Let's finish this thing without any more surprises.
Hope you're happy, junk pile. This game is going down, and it's all your fault.
Can it, Fix-It. And you, keep your mouth shut. That cy-bug you brought with you multiplied.
No, it died in the taffy swamp.
Bullroar. Are you just gonna stand there? I need backup! You evacuate the civilians.

Protect the Finish Line.Line: Another one of these? I thought we'd seen the last of 'em.

As Darkness Stirs.Line: So... If darkness IS behind this whole thing, it must be close by. But why hasn't it tried to harm us? What does it want?
Do you think it's watching us? Waiting to make a move?

I don't know. I'm not even sure that it IS responsible for all this. But it's the only theory that makes sense. If I'm right, and it's close, it knows we're onto it. It could be putting its plan into action as we speak.
So it might come for us?
Yeah. Like it did for Lauriam's sister.
Is that what happened to her? But why?
I don't know why it targeted Strelitzia. I just—
"Targeted" for what? What did you mean by that?
What happened to her!? Answer me!
So THIS is the plan. Clever.
Darkness's plan. Fear, doubt, anger... It's purposely messing with our hearts and making us turn on each other.
Tell me what happened to my sister...
I'm sorry, Lauriam... I'm responsible for what happened to her.
Ven. What did you do to Strelitzia?
Stay out of this! Answer me!
*scream*  It... It wasn't me... It wasn't me!

The Big Reveal.Line: Get off my track!
What, are you crazy? Knock it off!
I forbid you to cross that finish line!
Ralph, look!
Kid!
I'm not letting you undo all my hard work!
Is that...?
No, it can't be!
What the...Who are you?
I'm Turbo! The greatest racer ever!

That's Turbo. When a more popular game got plugged in and stole his thunder, he got so jealous that he abandoned his game and tried to take over the new one. The players thought it was broken, and Turbo ended up putting both games and himself out of order...for good.
That's why we say someone's "going Turbo" when they do something they're not meant to and mess up the game. I thought you were going Turbo when we first met, remember?

I'm the greatest racer in this arcade! I didn't escape my game, learn code, and reprogram this game to let you and your obese warthog of a friend take it away from me!  Turbo-tastic! End of the line, glitch!
Glitch...that's it! Come on. I know you said you wouldn't do it again, but you're going to do it one more time. Just focus and concentrate... ...and glitch!
Preposterous!
Sweet mother of monkey milk, I did it!
No!
Bring it home, kid! The finish line's wide open! No! Kid, are you okay?
I'm fine, I'm fine. Let's finish this race!
Ralph, look!
Come on. We gotta get out of here.
But I didn't cross the finish line!
There is no finish line.

Evacuate!.Line: Ralph, I can't leave the game. It's okay, Ralph.
Save it for later. We've got work to do. We can't let any of 'em leave! Got it?

A Great Plan.Line: Everybody out! We've got to blow up this exit.
There's nothing we can do. Without a beacon, there's no way to stop these monsters.
Beacon? Stay with Felix. Let me borrow this thing, lady. You tagging along?
What I do best. I'm gonna wreck it! I'll meet you at the finish line!

Confrontation.Line: Have you ever spoken with darkness?
Sure have.
What was it like?
Well... It wasn't much of a conversation. Didn't feel like I was getting through to it, and vice versa. Imagine trying to talk to someone with... a very unconventional thought process.
Huh, like you.
*gasp*
That's exactly what I mean.
You know, Luxu, some people actually respect their seniors. Maybe that's a novel concept to someone as coldhearted as you. In fact, I'd say you have more in common with darkness than I do.
Anyway... Darkness can at least understand what we're saying, right?
Well, of course. They've been watching us for long enough.
Really!? Are they watching now?
Oh, possibly! Kidding, kidding! No, they're not here. They wouldn't come near us without good reason.
That wasn't funny.
It was kinda funny.
Anyway... What about Ava's wielders, the Dandelions? What if they come face to face with darkness? They're tasked with the great duty of rebuilding our world. If anything happens to them...
Look, anyone who faces darkness is gonna have a bad time. You can't predict what they're gonna do or say. And they're really good at playing mind games.
So the Dandelions ARE in danger!

Maybe so. But if there's one thing darkness has an aversion to... ...it's those who are pure of heart. Their thoughts and emotions are completely foreign and utterly baffling. The same goes for all people— while darkness may recognize what we're up to, they can't comprehend our reasons. All they know is that we're the enemy. They'll never understand us, just like we'll never understand them. And that's why we'll always be at odds.
What's their end game?
Who knows? Your guess is as good as mine.
I have to say, I didn't expect you to look like such a cliché.
So you say. But I have no form to speak of. We mostly go unnoticed, after all.
What you see and hear now is for your benefit.
What do you want?
Want? I want nothing. I simply am.
Huh?
It must be hard for you to understand. We're very different. Unlike you, our actions don't serve a greater purpose or goal.
Then why did you take my sister? Why Strelitzia?
It was his will.
I don't believe you. Ven didn't even know her! Besides, he would never wish that on anyone.
You're right. They were strangers. But what he wished for was power. I simply helped him fulfill that wish by making him a Union leader.
Ven would never want that!
Wouldn't he?
Even if he did, he wouldn't go so far as to take it from someone, or steal their spot as leader.
Power is power. How it's acquired is of no consequence.
Then...it could've been any of us? It didn't have to be Strelitzia?
Yes.
You—!
Lauriam!
I have a few questions.
Go on.
Why Ven?
Because it was decided.
What was?
That he would harbor darkness.
Your vessel was chosen?
Yes. It was written in the Book of Prophecies.
You've read the Book?
In a manner of speaking, yes. At least the parts that matter to us.
How?
We read the words as they were being written.
In the Book?
Yes.
What exactly is your relationship with the Master?
We're old friends.
Friends? Then you and the Master are on the same side?
We have no need to side with people.
All right, next question. You've hidden from us all this time. Why show yourself now?
You're wrong. We haven't been hiding. You simply never noticed us before. All that's changed is that you've finally acknowledged our existence.
Last question. You keep saying "we," but what do you mean?
Shadows outnumber light.
Okay, last question. Are you the only one here right now?
Yes.
Good to know.
Huh?
Ephemer, Skuld. You ready? This is gonna be rough!
I'm really worried about the Dandelions.
The Book tells of a future with light. That's proof they'll be fine.
Are you sure?
Well, it's a pretty long read, so I skipped over the details of each individual person's fate.
Even though our future depends on them?
...You're not gonna let this go, are you? Tell you what. It's your role to keep watch, so why not watch over them while you're at it? But nothing more than that—don't go getting your hands dirty.
O-okay.

Wreck It!.Line: No, not now. I don't have time to deal with you! Boy am I glad you're here. Think you can take 'em? Thanks.

The Greatest Virus.Line: Hello, old friend. Like what you see? Be honest. Because of you, I'm now the most powerful virus in the arcade. I can take over any game I want. I should thank you, but it'd be more fun to kill you. You...You infiltrated this game from the outside, didn't you? That makes you a virus, too. If we join forces, we can rule this world together! Fine! Have some new friends to play with instead! Now all that's left is to get rid of you.  Have some candy!

The Final Stage.Line: You again? Hmph, I'll just have to take care of you both!

Up We Go.Line: Get back here, little guy. Up we go!

Being Me.Line: Look at that. Your little friend is doomed. Let's watch her die together, shall we?
Guess it's game over for both of you.
I'm bad, and that's good. I will never be good, and that's not bad. There's no one I'd rather be... ...than me. Kid?
Don't worry, I got it all under control!
You fools! Why are you going into the light– No, no! No! No! No! No! I must go into the light!
Ready? What's wrong? What, you forgot something? All right, come find us when you're done.

Not this again! If we're not the ones you're looking for, why are you following us? That does it! I was hoping we could find out what the Darklings are after, but I don't think that's gonna happen. There's only one thing to do now. Just kidding! Good luck!

Sugar Rush Royalty.Line: I wonder what it wanted. Wait a minute... The way the bugs are drawn to the beacons... Could the Darklings be drawn to Keyblade wielders in the same way? Oh, it's nothing. Just thinking out loud. Hey, how do you think Vanellope's doing? Let's go wait at the finish line!
As ready as I'll ever be.
Now I remember. All hail the rightful ruler of Sugar Rush, Princess Vanellope.
Wow, so this is the real you. A princess.
Ralph, what are you, nuts? This isn't me. This is me. Look, the code may say I'm a princess, but I know who I really am, Ralph. I'm a racer with the greatest superpower ever.

She's a princess, but in her heart she's a racer. It goes to show that sometimes people aren't what they seem. That can be said for anyone. Another version of yourself could be hiding inside your heart. But if that version of you belonged to darkness... Oh, i-it's nothing!
Fix-it, Wreck-it, the arcade's about to open. Let's move 'em out!
Now that things are back to normal, our world might be fixed too. Let's head back to Daybreak Town to see if the glitches are gone... ...and to share what we know about the Darklings.
You know, you could just stay here and live in the castle. You'd have your own wing where no one would ever complain about your stench or treat you bad ever again. You could be happy.

I'm already happy. I've got the coolest friend in the world. And besides, I've got a job to do, too. It may not be as fancy as being president, but it's my duty. And it's a big duty. See ya later, President Fartfeathers.
If the Darklings are looking for a Keyblade wielder, but it's not Player or Ephemer, who could it be...?

Our Plan.Line: And this box need to stay out of sight. Just watch with your own eyes—and my eye, of course—as things unfold between the others. Then, when the time is right, go off and do your thing.
It's a secret! And, well, you see... the thing is...  ...you can never, ever open it.
Great, now I really wanna know...
Ah, all right. I'll indulge you. But this secret stays between the two of us, and you have to promise never to open the box.
Can't you just tell me now?
And ruin the surprise? Well, I'd hate for anything to happen to you, so I will give you one little hint.

When darkness strikes at dawn and the lifeboat departs, this world will have fulfilled its purpose. If that happens, you have to see it through to the end, and take a corridor to a new world as fast as you can.
The world is going to end?

Haven't I told you? There's no way for us to win against the darkness. That's why we needed to use the time we had to get all those Keyblade wielders... ...ready to pass the torch to the next generation. This world exists to nurture the Dandelions, our little seeds of light, so they can be sown into the future, where they CAN stop the darkness. Then, the sun will finally set on this duskless dawn. And our plan will have succeeded at last.

The World's End.Line: It's over.
Yeah... I can't take you down alone. I'm not even sure I can wear you down.
Fair point.
Shall we call it done, then?
Oh? So you surrender?
*chuckle* You claimed you aren't after anything, but I'm not buying it.
What?
You seem pretty desperate to get in our way, showing up like this. I don't know if it's pride or fear, but there's a reason you're still here.
... Infection.
Meaning?
Data transfer requires a signal. The same goes for the hearts and minds of you humans. You underestimate how easily the darkness rides on those signals... ...and spreads through this place.
Is that why you wormed your way into the data world? But then why hide inside Ven?
I told you. Because it was decided.
That's enough.
Skuld! You're all right!
You're saying because it was written in the Book of Prophecies, it was meant to be? Well, I don't care. You hijacked Ven and attacked Lauriam's sister. And now you're gonna pay for it!
That's right.
We are many, and we are one. But to be one requires will. Through him, we could divide into pure darkness and light... ...willful and distinct. It was a sacrifice that needed to be made.
So... Ven didn't attack Strelitzia. You did. Is that right?
Lauriam!
I figured you guys could use some help.
One more ally will make no difference.
Then how about two?
Player!
It's useless. Even if you do manage to defeat us, you will still lose.
I don't think so. We're taking you down and going back to the real world.
And how do you plan on doing that? With the lifeboat?
Yeah. Just like the evil fairy, right?
You know nothing.
How do you figure?
If you return, Daybreak Town will still succumb to darkness.
What have you done to the real world?
Nothing. It was decided long ago. When the lifeboat is activated, this world falls to darkness. It is already in motion. The beginning of the end.
But why?

The lifeboat is the last line of defense— to be relied upon in the event we cannot be defeated. Its use initiates the process to seal this world, and us along with it. The evil fairy's departure was the trigger. It cannot be stopped.
But... ...that means...
We're just a bunch of pawns?
No. I don't believe it. Master Ava is the one who brought us together. I don't know about the other Masters, but I know for sure that Master Ava wouldn't just throw us away like that!
Besides, it doesn't matter what the Masters may have planned for us. We believe in our leader!
Let's do this.

Pure Light.Line: I am formless. You cannot destroy me.
If you're pure darkness, then that makes me pure light. If you used me to reshape yourself, then I can reshape you again. I'll give you a new form... ...that we can defeat!
Everything's going to be all right.

A Seed of Light.Line: Now to check on the data...
Aren't you supposed to be part of the whole?
Or are you acting on your own right now? Is that it?
Who are you? There shouldn't be any Keyblade Masters left in this world.
Figures you wouldn't know what's going on, seeing you didn't take a very good look at the Book.
Why are you here? You're only meant to observe.

I'm here because your friend— the Master of Masters—told me to be. Said I could watch what happens, but not to act. "Look, but don't touch." He always said the strangest things. But I've thought about it for a long time, and I think I know what he meant now.
If you use that, your plan is as good as ruined.
A seed of light to be planted in the future. The true Dandelion.

The Purpose.Line: What do you plan to do with this world?

When twilight ends, a new day begins. You see, this world exists in three stages. First, countless Keyblade wielders are brought together. Then, as they fight through fear and see their leaders fall, their numbers dwindle, while others learn to stand on their own. Finally, those left must decide what to do when faced with darkness in a sealed-off world. And when all seven of the lifeboat's pods depart, this world will end—and a new day will dawn.
So you came to this world just to end it?
Well, that wasn't my express purpose.
You have the Book of Prophecies, and therefore knowledge of all things. Strange that you would knowingly waste your time and efforts.

Whoa, you think the Book tells us EVERYTHING? Yeah, right! No way I'd have let you peek at something that important! No, the Book doesn't cover much at all. Just what the Keyblade I gave to Luxu sees, and even then, only the bits important enough to jot down. But to be honest, it doesn't matter what the Book does or doesn't contain. What matters is the point at which it was written, and how to get there.
What do you mean?

Anyone who tries to travel through time on the lifeboat will lose their body. To become whole again, they'll require two things at their destination: a medium to rebuild their body and someone with memories of them. The Book contains a waypoint.
All this was for a waypoint?
Sure was. Luxu has the memories, and my eye is the medium. I've got a direct line from A to B.
You used the Book and your apprentice to travel into the future?
I mean, that's not my final goal, but it is an important step. One that I won't be taking alone.
The seven pods, and the seven crowns...
For the seven lights.
Including your apprentice?
Who knows? Anyone could wind up using them.
You're even more clever than I thought.
I could say the same about you. What are you all up to, anyway?
What indeed?
In any case, I'm tired of watching you duke it out. Although, I did see something interesting in the future.
What might that be?
A world I can't even conceive.

Backup Data.Line: I hope everything's okay.
I'm sure it is.
Lauriam knows it wasn't Ven's fault, right?
Should we check on them?
No, Lauriam said everything was fine.
All right. Do you really think the world is going to end?
I'm not sure. There's a lot we don't know. About this world, the Keyblade Masters, darkness...
Yeah.
But think back to what Master Ava taught us. That when this world is shrouded in darkness, it'll just go to sleep.
I remember that.

It's not much, I know, but it's enough to keep me from giving up hope. I played a part in bringing the Dandelions together, so I have a responsibility to save everyone. And I'm gonna try my best to do that.
It's not your responsibility alone. But whatever you do decide to do, you have our support. I want you to know that.
Thanks for always being there, Skuld. Oh? Hi there.

I'm sorry, Ventus. I know it wasn't your fault. I just needed someone to blame. Darkness is so...abstract. My anger needed a simple, tangible target. Selfish of me, I know. But some emotions are too much to bear. Tell me. Is darkness really gone? Or has it become a part of you, just like you said? If it has, then I-
Hatred, anger, and sadness... That's exactly what they want. You have to let it go. What happened to my kind and loving brother?
Strelitzia!?
Lauriam. Someone's here to see you.
Who? Elrena? What are you doing here?
Well, I thought you should know... It's about Strelitzia. Chirithy claims to have seen her.
What!?
You saw my sister? Where!?
Maybe it wasn't her, but... A few days ago...I spotted someone who looked an awful lot like her headed toward town from the hill. And she wasn't alone. She was with someone in a black coat.
But how?
Hmm... We can't be sure of anything yet, but it's definitely an interesting piece of information.
A black coat could only mean... One of the Keyblade Masters?
Most likely. Both the Master of Masters and Luxu fit the description.
But the Master shouldn't be here, even if this were the real world. ...Wait a minute. Maybe—
What is it?
Do you remember why this data world was created?
As a backup of the real one.
Right. To save the world as it was before the Keyblade War. That means Strelitzia's data must be stored here too.
Really? I thought this place was just a copy of the world, not its people. Besides, if everyone's data was brought over, shouldn't there be versions of us here too?

Yep. Our data should be here as well. Could be that it's still locked up and hasn't been touched yet. Think about it. Elrena saw a glitched version of Strelitzia. If what Chirithy says is true, maybe her data is here and someone managed to access it.
I don't understand. Why Strelitzia? And if her data does exist, does that mean we can bring her back?
I don't know.
Who would do something like that? As far as we know, all of the Masters are gone.
We'll probably have more luck finding answers in the real world.
About that—if what Darkness said was true, we should be able to use the lifeboat in the basement to get back. But if that's somehow linked to the end of this world...
We don't have time to think about that now. Come on, let's go to the basement. Would you mind carrying Ven?
Not at all.

The Shadow's Identity.Line: I don't know who you sent, but there are five left. Who will they go to?
You didn't read that part of the Book?
It wasn't of any interest to me.
So what is, then?
Expansion.
I don't get you.
Nor we you. You spent time grooming these wielders, only to trap and leave them behind in the data world. Why?
Dunno. Who knows what the Master of Master's thinking?
And yet you follow him?
Why not? I may not know the reasoning behind everything he does, but I can guess.
But you're not certain.
No. But I am sure of one thing. He is not a fan of darkness.
I see. That we understand. We're not fond of light either.
So what's your brilliant plan?
To spread throughout the data world using its signals. To accompany the chosen one into the future, so I can lay claim to worlds not yet created.
Right, expansion. So no matter what world or time I end up in, you'll be there too, huh. I don't think so.
Oh? I thought you were told not to interfere.
Yeah, to help the Dandelions. But I'm not doing this for them. I'm doing this for me.
I am formless. You cannot destroy me.
I know.
Then why waste the effort?

The longer you exist without a tangible form, the more your will fades. Darkness had form when the Master of Masters was a boy, right? You abandoned it to defeat light— that's when darkness became a whole. But then you realized... ...that you couldn't maintain your will as one or as a whole. Which is why... ...you still need a physical form. You call it infection and expansion, but you're just stealing the bodies of those with hearts. You act like it's this grandiose plan, when it's actually sad and pathetic.
Silence!
You never even figured out his real plan, did you?
What?
Let me ask you this. Besides you, there are five other shadows with individual will. I know at least one is in the data world. So where are the other four?
You're well informed. Yes, six of us remained after the war, after which we found ourselves in the data world.
But you returned to the real world with the evil fairy. Meaning the rest are still there.
Yes.
Then you're the only one in my way.
As you are in mine.

Resolutions.Line: I count six.
The evil fairy took the seventh.
But there are seven of us.
So we're short one.
Two. This one's broken, so we're down to five.
What should we do? What's—-
We're running out of time. We need to decide who goes.
But we're not the only Dandelions.
Yeah, what about the rest of the wielders?
They'll go to sleep. Just like a computer in sleep mode.
Sleep...?
Master Ava taught us that, remember? When all is shrouded in darkness, the world will fall into slumber.
Right.

The Master of Masters knew this would happen and created a backup of the world. A place to shelter and keep us safe. That's where we are. And if something causes this world to freeze, it can be rebooted and restored. The end of this world is nothing like the end of the real one. Like I said: sleep mode.
So it's not THIS world we need to be worried about.
Even if we use the lifeboat to get back, we'll have to use it again to go wherever it is that we need to go after. And who knows where that'll be? Is escape really the right answer?
Whether we stay or go, it's a gamble.
Right. But if no one goes back, then no one there will know what's happened here. There'll be no rescuing anyone left behind.
And we can't let that happen. We Keyblade wielders need to live on.
Ephemer and I should split up.
Agreed. Brain, you should go back. Having you in the real world will give us the best chance to save the people here.
Got it.
I'm not a Union leader or anything, so...
Listen, the only way to make it out of this is to go back. We're the ones responsible for this whole situation in the first place. So you, Ven, andPlayer  should go.
Brain, Player, Elrena, and Ven each take one.
Skuld, Lauriam, one of you should take the last—
Lauriam, it's yours.
What?
If there's a chance you'll get your sister back, then you need to be there for her. Besides, you'll have a better chance of finding answers over there. You should take it.
I don't deserve a spot...
Yes, you do. You gave me hope for the first time since Strelitzia went missing. Help me find her. Please.
There's only one way out of here and the seating's limited—for now. When I get back, I promise I'll find a way to save everyone here.
Thanks. All right, we don't have much time. Who's going?
I'll stay. I'm not even a Dandelion, I'm just here as your friend. So if you're staying, so am I.
Player ...
Besides, I don't want to have to wait for you again.
I'm not leaving you two here.
Well, why don't we save one for later? I might be able to find a way to rescue all three of you at once.
You already have something in mind, don't you?
Sure do.
Then it's settled. Lauriam, can you look after Ven? Hop in, Elrena. Brain, take care of everyone.
Will do. Here, take it.
But this is yours...
It was meant for you. This too. I didn't end up using it, but if you're ever lost, don't hesitate to have a look. It'll help you when you need it most.
I'll hold onto these for now, but as far as I'm concerned, they still belong to you. Master Ava entrusted them to you for a reason.

I thought you'd be happy. Master Ava told me you've been wanting to read the Book for a long time. Besides, I'm pretty sure she gave these to me knowing I would do just this. May your heart be your guiding key, Ephemer. Just like mine is for me.
Thanks.
I'll be back for you guys.
Player, are you sure about this?
Yep! I'm right where I want to be.
Be safe.

7 and 13.Line: The world is going to end?

Haven't I told you? There's no way for us to win against the darkness. That's why we needed to use the time we had to get all those Keyblade wielders... ...ready to pass the torch to the next generation. This world exists to nurture the Dandelions, our little seeds of light, so they can be sown into the future, where they CAN stop the darkness. Then, the sun will finally set on this duskless dawn. And our plan will have succeeded at last.
I'll get started then.
Oh, wait, I almost forgot.
There's more?

Like I said, we've been fighting darkness for a long, long time. During this battle, darkness shed its form and began attacking our hearts instead of our bodies, claiming countless allies of mine along the way. But at some point, darkness realized that without form, they would eventually lose their individual will. Which brings us to now.
Darkness has no form?

"From seven, all is fulfilled. From thirteen, chaos is born." As it states, darkness began as thirteen. Without form, they spread throughout and became a whole. The ones that continued to spread... ...and derived their own forms became the Heartless, while those without forms developed individual will. And now the formless yearn to take over the bodies of those with strong hearts.
Strong hearts...?
You can't destroy darkness if it has no form, which is why you need a vessel with a strong heart. That's where you all come in.
Wait a minute...

I know how it sounds, but believe me when I say that I didn't train you all... just to turn you into vessels. I pushed you to become resilient— resilient enough to withstand darkness even if it were to take over your hearts.
This was your plan...

This is war— between people and something entirely different. You can't afford to get sentimental; you need to be pragmatic. I chose this fate for you because I believed you could bear it. Now listen. There are thirteen darknesses. Of those thirteen, we'll trap the most powerful seven inside the hearts of each of us. We'll all go our separate ways and destroy the darkness wherever we end up. That's the true purpose of the Keyblade War.
Is it really necessary for the Unions to betray each other? Is the War the only way?

It is. I used the passage in the Book about the traitor... ...to plant doubt inside all of you for darkness to feed on. For them to take the bait, we all need to harbor true, real emotions. And when emotions grow and clash, they'll get stronger, and eventually the seven shadows will try to take over our hearts.
And you want them to succeed?
Yes. As for the remaining six, five will feed on the Union leaders, and the last one will be trapped in this world.
You can't do this! The sacrifice is too great!

I told you... ...not to let sentiment cloud your judgment. It's a tragedy when darkness takes over someone's heart. I know that all too well... ...because I've seen those that I cared about, my closest allies, drown in darkness. This isn't some heroic tale about the battle between light and darkness. It's about honoring the dignity of those with hearts. Besides, I'm not planning on sacrificing anyone. I have a safety plan.
May your heart be your guiding key. Your thoughts, your feelings, your actions— you are the key to the future. I'm counting on you, traitor Luxu.

To Keep Light Alive.Line: Any progress?
Well... I tried looking for a way to get everyone back at once using the existing system, but it's not a viable option with the time we have.
So that's it?
There might be another way. Not for all of the Dandelions, but I think I can help Ephemer and the others at least. But before I do anything, I want you to hop back in the lifeboat.
What?
I need to work quickly to have a decent shot at this. But first, I'm going to get you out of this world.
What's your plan?
Return two of the pods to the data world. That way, the three of them will each have one.
Will that work?
Only one way to find out. Get in.
Will you really be okay on your own?
The only Union leader who can escape right now is you. Ephemer gave me this chance to keep hope and light alive, and now I'm passing it on to you. Let me do this.
All right.
I don't know where or when you'll end up. But keep your goal—your waypoint— etched in your heart.
I will. I assumed people's data just didn't exist when I couldn't find my sister's. But I was wrong. It does.
Then that will be the waypoint to guide you. I hope you get to see her again.
I hope I get to see you again too.
May your heart be your guiding key.
Brain!
Who—?
So it's just you?

Fall to Darkness.Line: Do you think they all got there safely?
Yeah, he's always got a plan. Unlike someone I know.
I can't believe the world is ending.
No need for alarm. We are not here to fight.
We merely ask that you open our gate before you leave.
Oh, yes. The darkness you fought must have told you our purpose: infection. We will travel through portals and infect other worlds.
And you thought we'd just agree to that?
You have no choice. We overpower you.
We could take over one of you here and now.
You can open our gate of your own will, or out of regret and shame at losing a friend before your very eyes.
(Once this starts, get in the lifeboat.)
This is why people cannot defeat darkness.
Player's heart has been lost to darkness.
I am formless. You cannot destroy me.
I thought we'd dealt with you...
Open a gate, and he will be returned.

Separated.Line: If only you'd gotten in the lifeboat.
Let your hatred grow. It fuels us.
No!!! I'm sorry. I'm so sorry...

I'll Figure It Out.Line: So it's just you?
That's right. You are...?
Luxu. One of the Master of Master's apprentices.
Huh? Master Luxu? I thought you disappeared before the Unions were created.
None of that matters now. Tell me, are you a Union leader?
Yes, my name's Brain.
And you're the only one here, I see. Where're the others?
One escaped, but two are still in the data world.
That makes four. What about the fifth? Are they gone?
Yes...
I see. So that's yours then?
No. Three of my friends stayed behind in the data world. I'm going to send both of these there, and with the one they already have, they can all get back.
Then what will you do?
Stay here and stay alive as long as I can. I need to wake as many of the Dandelions stuck in the data world as possible.
Wake?
Master Ava taught us... ...that when a world becomes enveloped in darkness, it falls into slumber.
It does, but the data world is different.
How so?
That world was built as a cage to entrap darkness. If it falls to darkness, that's it.
No...
And another thing. The lifeboat is incomplete. Whoever uses it needs two things at their destination: someone with memories of them, and a vessel to occupy. Were you aware of that?
More or less.
Do you have a plan?
Well, I'll figure it out, no matter how long it takes.
You're pretty smart, aren't you? It's a shame this lifetime is the only one you've got.

Locked Inside.Line: Using anger to get them to open our gate for us.
Through this portal, we can access and infect countless worlds.
It's time you rid yourself of that brittle human vessel. Unless you wish to waste away along with it.
I didn't think tricking you guys would be so easy. Are all of you this gullible?

You don't have a physical form, but you need a key to unlock doors for you. Seems real inconvenient. Ephemer locked the gate back there. This one here is locked too. Looks to me like you have no way out.
You... It was all an act?
Took you long enough. How does it feel to be outsmarted?
I'm sorry. I didn't mean to drag you into this too.

Nightfall.Line: Let's take a look outside. Skuld, it's way too dangerous out here. Let's go back inside.
It takes so much time and effort to create, but only an instant to destroy...

A World of Fiction.Line: It is important to understand your enemy.
Is it important for darkness? Or just you?

A chessboard makes for a small world. Easy to understand, easy to control. Now imagine it expands slowly, one fairy tale at a time, without end or limit. No matter how large the world grows, no matter how many countless lives are spent expanding it, darkness spreads to every corner. It's kind of unfair, really. We can run and we can hide, but you always seem to stick with us every step of the way.
I could use some time alone, you know.
So where is it that you plan to run off to next?
A new world. One that I can't even conceive. A world where neither light nor darkness rules.

Do you know what sets people apart from other living beings? People want to believe in the future, even if they won't be around to see it. I want to believe, too. Believe in a world beyond what we can imagine. A world of fiction.
Nope. If you imagine hard enough, you can make anything a reality. Like I said, a world I can't even conceive.
A place where voices and sight can't reach. A —— world.

Ephemer & Skuld.Line: Thank you for being here, Ephemer. I'm glad I don't have to face the end alone.
It's not over till it's over, Skuld.

Goodnight.Line: We're connected to the hearts of our Keyblade wielders. When your heart disappears, so do we. And when you fall asleep, we become your protectors.
Am I going to sleep too?
If you don't your heart will simply melt into a new one. What is it?

Destinations.Line: May your heart be your guiding key.

An Unfamiliar Town.Line: Oh, I'm terribly sorry. My name is Sigurd. Could you give me a moment? I need to make a report. Apologies for the wait. Come, I'll take you to our headquarters.
Headquarters? What are you talking about?
It was decided that you would escape Daybreak Town amidst its destruction and arrive here today. And that we would welcome you.
It was decided? What do you mean?
Allow me to explain once we get there.
Wait. What about the others? Some of my friends escaped with me.
You are the only one who arrived in this time.
I realize this must all be very confusing, but if you would please come with me...
The original Keyblade Master and founder of this town, Scala ad Caelum. That is Master Ephemer.
I know. He was a good friend.
